items.name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
items.description: The best free intro to causal inference. DiD, IV, RDD, synthetic control — all with Python code you can run. No fluff.

items.name: The Effect
items.description: DAGs that don't suck. Nick HK explains causality like he's at a whiteboard, not a lectern. Free, modern, and actually enjoyable to read.

items.name: Causal Inference: The Mixtape
items.description: Scott Cunningham's guide — reads like a conversation, not a textbook. Code in Stata, R, and Python.

items.name: CausalML (Uber) Documentation
items.description: Synthetic data tutorials that feel like a game. Generate fake users, apply treatment, challenge yourself to recover the effect using Random Forest.

items.name: EconML Documentation
items.description: Microsoft's library for ML-based causal inference. Tutorials on heterogeneous treatment effects, double ML, and more.

items.name: DoWhy Library
items.description: Microsoft's causal inference library. Great for understanding causal graphs and robustness checks.

items.name: Causal ML Book (Chernozhukov et al.)
items.description: Applied Causal Inference Powered by ML and AI. Double/debiased ML, heterogeneous effects, and modern methods from the pioneers.

items.name: DoWhy User Guide
items.description: Microsoft's causal inference library. Graph-based causal inference, discovery algorithms, and Python implementations. Free official docs.

items.name: PyMC Labs Blog
items.description: Bayesian causal inference done right. MCMC, probabilistic programming, and causal models from the PyMC team.

items.name: CausalPy
items.description: Synthetic controls that feel like scikit-learn. Built on PyMC, perfect for quasi-experiments when you can't randomize.

items.name: Andrew Gelman's Blog
items.description: Stats, causal inference, experiment pitfalls. Frank, often funny, always insightful. The most-read stats blog for good reason.

items.name: Applied Econometrics Notes (Lal)
items.description: Applied econometrics notes and code by Apoorva Lal covering modern causal inference methods.

items.name: A Practitioner's Guide to DiD
items.description: Jonathan Roth et al.'s comprehensive guide to modern difference-in-differences. Staggered timing, pre-trends, and new estimators.

items.name: Causal RL Bridges
items.description: Educational resource on the synergies between causal inference and reinforcement learning. Includes code examples for optimal control using causal agents.

items.name: Eppo's Experimentation Guides
items.description: Practical guides on experiment design, stats engines, CUPED, and common pitfalls. Written by practitioners.

items.name: A/B Testing on Social Networks
items.description: Simulates a social graph in Python to prove why network effects ruin experiments, then shows cluster-based fixes.

items.name: DoorDash: Switchback Tests
items.description: Why treating one user affects another in marketplaces. Clear diagrams explaining interference as a living organism, not a static dataset.

items.name: Understanding Switchback Experiments (2024)
items.description: A modern take on SUTVA violations. Why you randomize time, not users, in marketplaces. The 30-minute window trick explained.

items.name: Uber: Making Experiment Evaluation 100x Faster
items.description: When your p-value calculation has billions of rows. The engineering reality of running causal inference at Uber scale.

items.name: Nextmv: Switchback Testing
items.description: Documentation that reads like a tutorial. Exact logic to split time into windows and washout periods for network A/B tests in Python.

items.name: Matteo Courthoud: Understanding CUPED
items.description: The most accessible yet rigorous CUPED explanation. Derives the math showing variance reduction is proportional to (1-ρ²), compares with autoregression and difference-in-differences. Perfect for economists.

items.name: Bytepawn: CUPED in Python
items.description: Short, punchy script simulating 1,000 experiments to prove variance actually goes down. Very satisfying to run.

items.name: Statsig Resources
items.description: Deep dives on sequential testing, variance reduction, and experiment analysis. Free stats engine docs.

items.name: Evan Miller's A/B Testing Tools
items.description: Best-in-class visual, interactive calculators for sample size, chi-squared tests, sequential sampling. Cited in Udacity's Google A/B testing course. Helps practitioners understand 'under the hood' statistics while planning experiments.

items.name: Evan Miller: How Not To Run an A/B Test
items.description: The article that taught the industry why peeking at p-values is a sin. Short, lethal, career-saving.

items.name: QuantEcon Lectures
items.description: High-quality computational economics in Python and Julia. Dynamic programming, time series, asset pricing — all with code.

items.name: Coding for Economists
items.description: Arthur Turrell's practical guide. Python basics through advanced workflows — built specifically for econ researchers.

items.name: The Missing Semester (MIT)
items.description: Command line, Git, debugging, shell scripting. The CS skills they don't teach in econ PhD programs but you absolutely need.

items.name: Beyond Jupyter
items.description: Software design principles for ML applications. Go from messy notebooks to maintainable, modular code with OOP essentials and refactoring guides.

items.name: fast.ai Practical Deep Learning
items.description: Train a model in 10 minutes. Understand why it works later. Jeremy Howard's famous 'code first, theory second' approach to deep learning.

items.name: Introduction to Statistical Learning
items.description: The 'I actually finished this one' ML book. Free with runnable Python code. Math when you need it, intuition first.

items.name: The Elements of Statistical Learning
items.description: The more rigorous sibling of ISLR. Hastie, Tibshirani, and Friedman's classic on statistical learning theory. Free PDF from Stanford.

items.name: Forecasting: Principles and Practice

items.description: THE foundational paper on web experimentation. Covers hypothesis testing, sample size, metrics, and common pitfalls. 2000+ citations.

items.name: Overlapping Experiment Infrastructure: More, Better, Faster Experimentation
items.description: Google's infrastructure for running overlapping experiments, enabling hundreds of simultaneous tests without interference.

items.name: Diagnosing Sample Ratio Mismatch in Online Controlled Experiments: A Taxonomy and Rules of Thumb for Practitioners
items.description: The definitive SRM paper from Microsoft/Booking.com—provides taxonomy of causes and 10 diagnostic rules; ~6% of experiments exhibit SRM.

items.name: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments: Five Puzzling Outcomes Explained
items.description: Foundational Microsoft paper on experiment validity; coined OEC design principles and trustworthiness checks now industry standard.

items.name: A Dirty Dozen: Twelve Common Metric Interpretation Pitfalls in Online Controlled Experiments
items.description: Essential guide to metric design—introduces metric taxonomy (OEC, guardrail, diagnostic) with real experiment examples.

items.name: Improving the Sensitivity of Online Controlled Experiments by Utilizing Pre-Experiment Data (CUPED)
items.description: The CUPED method that uses pre-experiment covariates to dramatically reduce variance in experiment metrics.

items.name: Regression Adjustments for Analyzing Randomized Experiments
items.description: Shows how regression adjustment in randomized experiments yields valid inference even with heterogeneous treatment effects.

items.name: Variance Reduction in Randomized Experiments
items.description: Optimal stratification and regression adjustment methods for experimental data with theoretical guarantees.

items.name: Machine Learning for Variance Reduction in Online Experiments
items.description: Introduces MLRATE—extends CUPED to ML models via cross-fitting; achieved 70%+ variance reduction over difference-in-means at Meta.

items.name: Adjusting Treatment Effect Estimates by Post-Stratification in Randomized Experiments
items.description: Theoretical foundation for post-stratification; proves it's nearly as efficient as blocking with variance difference O(1/n²).

items.name: Improving the Sensitivity of Online Controlled Experiments: Case Studies at Netflix
items.description: Industry workhorse comparing stratification, post-stratification, and CUPED at scale; recommends post-assignment techniques.

items.name: Peeking at A/B Tests: Why It Matters, and What to Do About It
items.description: Analyzes the peeking problem in A/B tests and introduces always-valid p-values for sequential testing.

items.name: Safe Testing
items.description: E-values and safe anytime-valid inference that allows optional stopping while controlling type I error.

items.name: A/B Testing with Fat Tails
items.description: Addresses the problem of highly variable metrics in experiments and proposes robust statistical methods.

items.name: A Multiple Testing Procedure for Clinical Trials
items.description: Foundational classic (3,200+ citations)—established group sequential boundaries that all modern methods build upon.

items.name: Time-uniform, Nonparametric, Nonasymptotic Confidence Sequences
items.description: Modern theoretical foundation for anytime-valid inference; backbone for GrowthBook, Spotify, and other industry tools.

items.name: Continuous Monitoring of A/B Tests without Pain: Optional Stopping in Bayesian Testing
items.description: Rigorous theoretical grounding for Bayesian sequential testing with continuous monitoring; Microsoft's framework.

items.name: Detecting Network Effects: Randomizing Over Randomized Experiments
items.description: Graph cluster randomization and design-based methods for detecting interference in network experiments.

items.name: Estimating Peer Effects in Networks with Peer Encouragement Designs
items.description: Two-stage randomization design for identifying peer effects in social networks.

items.name: Experimentation in Two-Sided Marketplaces
items.description: Framework for experiments in marketplaces where treatment of one side affects the other.

items.name: Estimating Average Causal Effects Under General Interference
items.description: The seminal exposure mapping paper—unified framework for design, exposure mapping, and estimands under network interference.

items.name: Design and Analysis of Bipartite Experiments Under a Linear Exposure-Response Model
items.description: Essential for two-sided marketplaces—introduces ERL estimator for buyer/seller and rider/driver experiment structures.

items.name: A Review of Spatial Causal Inference Methods for Environmental and Epidemiological Applications
items.description: Comprehensive review of spatial interference methods including geostatistical approaches for location-based spillovers.

items.name: Switchback Experiments and Randomized Experiments for Estimating Platform-Level Effects
items.description: Design and analysis of switchback experiments for marketplace interventions at Airbnb.

items.name: Causal Impact: A New Approach to Estimate Causal Effects
items.description: Google's Bayesian structural time-series approach for measuring impact of geo-level interventions.

items.name: GeoLift: Open Source Solution for Measuring Incremental Impact
items.description: Meta's open-source tool for geo-experiment design and measurement using synthetic control methods.

items.name: Design and Analysis of Switchback Experiments
items.description: The definitive switchback paper—optimal design under carryover effects with minimax formulation; used by Uber, Lyft, DoorDash.

items.name: Using Synthetic Controls: Feasibility, Data Requirements, and Methodological Aspects
items.description: Authoritative methodological review from synthetic control's creator; called 'most important innovation in policy evaluation in 15 years'.

items.name: Trimmed Match Design for Randomized Paired Geo Experiments
items.description: Addresses power analysis for geo experiments with few heterogeneous regions; foundation for Google's Trimmed Match library.

items.name: Surrogate Index: Combining Short-Term Proxies to Estimate Long-Term Treatment Effects
items.description: Framework for using short-term outcomes to predict long-term treatment effects in experiments.

items.name: Long-term Causal Inference Under Persistent Confounding via Data Combination
items.description: Methods for combining experimental and observational data to estimate persistent treatment effects.

items.name: Novelty and Primacy: A Long-Term Estimator for Online Experiments
items.description: First scalable method to estimate user-learning effects (novelty/primacy) via difference-in-differences across thousands of Microsoft experiments.

items.name: Evaluating the Surrogate Index as a Decision-Making Tool Using 200 A/B Tests at Netflix
items.description: Largest empirical validation of surrogates—95% consistency between 14-day surrogate predictions and 63-day outcomes across 1,098 test arms.

items.name: Estimation of the Proportion of Treatment Effect Explained by a High-Dimensional Surrogate
items.description: First rigorous method for high-dimensional surrogates where number of surrogates exceeds sample size; essential for multi-metric settings.

items.name: The Central Role of the Propensity Score in Observational Studies
items.description: The foundational paper introducing propensity scores for causal inference in observational studies.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Matching & Propensity Scores

items.name: Matching as Nonparametric Preprocessing for Reducing Model Dependence
items.description: Best practices for matching methods and the MatchIt software implementation.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Matching & Propensity Scores

items.name: Double/Debiased Machine Learning for Treatment and Structural Parameters
items.description: The double ML framework using cross-fitting to obtain valid inference with ML first-stage estimation.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Matching & Propensity Scores

items.name: Entropy Balancing for Causal Effects: A Multivariate Reweighting Method to Produce Balanced Samples in Observational Studies
items.description: Introduced entropy balancing, which achieves exact covariate balance through maximum entropy reweighting—eliminating iterative propensity score model searching.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Matching & Propensity Scores

items.name: Doubly Robust Estimation in Missing Data and Causal Inference Models
items.description: Accessible exposition of the augmented IPW estimator, consistent if either propensity score or outcome model is correct—the foundational 'doubly robust' property.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Matching & Propensity Scores

items.name: Semiparametric Efficiency in Multivariate Regression Models with Missing Data
items.description: Foundational theoretical paper deriving semiparametric efficiency bounds and introducing the AIPW estimator class underlying all modern doubly robust methods.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Matching & Propensity Scores

items.name: What's Trending in Difference-in-Differences? A Synthesis of the Recent Econometrics Literature
items.description: Comprehensive review of modern DiD methods including staggered adoption and heterogeneous effects.

items.name: Difference-in-Differences with Variation in Treatment Timing
items.description: Decomposes two-way fixed effects estimators and reveals issues with staggered DiD designs.

items.name: Difference-in-Differences with Multiple Time Periods
items.description: Group-time average treatment effects and aggregation methods for staggered DiD.

items.name: Two-Way Fixed Effects Estimators with Heterogeneous Treatment Effects
items.description: Demonstrates TWFE regressions estimate weighted sums of ATEs with potentially negative weights—proposing the DIDM estimator as solution.

items.name: Estimating Dynamic Treatment Effects in Event Studies with Heterogeneous Treatment Effects
items.description: Shows TWFE event-study coefficients are contaminated by effects from other periods, proposing an interaction-weighted estimator.

items.name: A More Credible Approach to Parallel Trends
items.description: Formal sensitivity analysis for parallel trends violations—implemented in the widely-used HonestDiD package.

items.name: Synthetic Control Methods for Comparative Case Studies
items.description: The foundational synthetic control paper with the California tobacco application.

items.name: Using Synthetic Controls: Feasibility, Data Requirements, and Methodological Aspects
items.description: Practical guidance on when and how to apply synthetic control methods.

items.name: Synthetic Difference in Differences
items.description: Combines synthetic control and DiD for improved inference in panel data settings.

items.name: Matrix Completion Methods for Causal Panel Data Models
items.description: Bridges matrix completion/ML with synthetic control using nuclear norm regularization—handles staggered adoption and outperforms traditional SC.

items.name: The Augmented Synthetic Control Method
items.description: Extends synthetic control to settings where perfect pre-treatment fit is infeasible using ridge regression to de-bias estimates.

items.name: Synthetic Control Method: Inference, Sensitivity Analysis and Confidence Sets
items.description: Essential theoretical foundation for statistical inference in SC applications, extending permutation tests and constructing proper confidence sets.

items.name: Identification and Estimation of Local Average Treatment Effects
items.description: The LATE framework for interpreting IV estimates as effects on compliers.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Instrumental Variables & LATE

items.name: Identification of Causal Effects Using Instrumental Variables
items.description: Defines the assumptions needed for IV and connects to potential outcomes framework.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Instrumental Variables & LATE

items.name: Testing for Weak Instruments in Linear IV Regression
items.description: Foundational framework for detecting weak instruments—the origin of the 'first-stage F > 10' rule now required in all IV applications.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Instrumental Variables & LATE

items.name: Quasi-Experimental Shift-Share Research Designs
items.description: Modern econometric framework for Bartik instruments—identification follows from quasi-random shock assignment rather than exogenous shares.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Instrumental Variables & LATE

items.name: Judging Judge Fixed Effects
items.description: Develops nonparametric tests for exclusion and monotonicity in examiner IV designs—essential for criminal justice, disability, and immigration research.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Instrumental Variables & LATE

items.name: Regression Discontinuity Designs in Economics
items.description: Comprehensive guide to RDD identification, estimation, and practical implementation.

items.name: A Practical Introduction to Regression Discontinuity Designs
items.description: Modern implementation guide with rdrobust software for sharp and fuzzy RDD.

items.name: Manipulation of the Running Variable in the Regression Discontinuity Design: A Density Test
items.description: Introduces the canonical density discontinuity test for detecting manipulation at the cutoff—now a required falsification check in all RDD work.

items.name: Optimal Bandwidth Choice for the Regression Discontinuity Estimator
items.description: Derives the MSE-optimal bandwidth for local linear RD estimation—the first principled approach to bandwidth selection.

items.name: Robust Nonparametric Confidence Intervals for Regression-Discontinuity Designs
items.description: Shows MSE-optimal bandwidths yield invalid conventional CIs and develops bias-corrected robust inference—foundation for the rdrobust package.

items.name: Estimation and Inference of Heterogeneous Treatment Effects using Random Forests
items.description: Causal forests for estimating conditional average treatment effects with valid confidence intervals.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Double ML & Heterogeneous Effects

items.name: Generic Machine Learning Inference on Heterogeneous Treatment Effects in Randomized Experiments
items.description: Framework for using any ML method to find heterogeneous effects with valid inference.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Double ML & Heterogeneous Effects

items.name: Metalearners for Estimating Heterogeneous Treatment Effects using Machine Learning
items.description: Taxonomy of metalearners (S-learner, T-learner, X-learner) for CATE estimation.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Double ML & Heterogeneous Effects

items.name: Quasi-Oracle Estimation of Heterogeneous Treatment Effects
items.description: Introduces the R-learner framework achieving quasi-oracle efficiency—matching error bounds of an oracle knowing nuisance components.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Double ML & Heterogeneous Effects

items.name: Towards Optimal Doubly Robust Estimation of Heterogeneous Causal Effects
items.description: Establishes model-free oracle inequalities for the DR-learner—doubly robust CATE estimation achieves faster convergence rates.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Double ML & Heterogeneous Effects

items.name: Policy Learning With Observational Data
items.description: Theoretical foundations for learning optimal treatment policies from observational data using doubly robust scores.
items.category: Observational Causal Inference > Double ML & Heterogeneous Effects

items.name: Sensitivity Analysis in Observational Research: Introducing the E-Value
items.description: The E-value for quantifying sensitivity to unmeasured confounding.

items.name: Making Sense of Sensitivity: Extending Omitted Variable Bias
items.description: Modern sensitivity analysis framework with intuitive benchmarking against observed covariates.

items.name: Nonparametric Bounds on Treatment Effects
items.description: Foundational paper establishing the partial identification paradigm—showing what can be learned under minimal assumptions when point identification fails.

items.name: Training, Wages, and Sample Selection: Estimating Sharp Bounds on Treatment Effects
items.description: Developed the 'Lee bounds' trimming procedure for handling attrition under monotonicity—now a standard robustness check for differential selection.

items.name: Unobservable Selection and Coefficient Stability: Theory and Evidence
items.description: Shows how to jointly use coefficient movements and R-squared changes to bound omitted variable bias—the workhorse sensitivity analysis.

items.name: Selection on Observed and Unobserved Variables: Assessing the Effectiveness of Catholic Schools
items.description: Pioneered the insight that selection on observables guides selection on unobservables—framework for assessing confounding needed to explain away effects.

items.name: The Theory and Practice of Revenue Management
items.description: The definitive textbook on revenue management covering pricing, capacity control, and overbooking.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing in the Presence of Inventory Considerations
items.description: Framework for dynamic pricing with finite inventory and strategic consumers.

items.name: Pricing and Revenue Optimization
items.description: Comprehensive practitioner's guide to pricing strategy and optimization techniques.

items.name: Optimal Dynamic Pricing of Inventories with Stochastic Demand over Finite Horizons
items.description: The foundational paper for dynamic pricing theory—establishes intensity control formulation, proves optimality of monotonically decreasing prices. 4,000+ citations.

items.name: A Multiproduct Dynamic Pricing Problem and Its Applications to Network Yield Management
items.description: Extends dynamic pricing to multiple products sharing capacity constraints—the theoretical foundation for airline network revenue management and cloud computing.

items.name: Clearance Pricing and Inventory Policies for Retail Chains
items.description: Multi-location markdown optimization balancing store-level heterogeneity.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing with a Prior on Market Response
items.description: Bayesian approach to learning demand while optimizing markdown paths.

items.name: The Value of Fast Fashion: Quick Response, Enhanced Design, and Strategic Consumer Behavior
items.description: The definitive paper on fast fashion economics—models how Zara-style systems mitigate strategic consumer behavior and reduce markdowns.

items.name: Coordinating Clearance Markdown Sales of Seasonal Products in Retail Chains
items.description: Foundational paper on multi-store clearance optimization using stochastic dynamic programming with real Falabella case study.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing and Learning: Historical Origins, Current Research, and New Directions
items.description: The definitive survey on explore-exploit pricing literature—synthesizes OR/MS, economics, marketing, and CS covering regret bounds and bandit connections.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing and Matching in Ride-Hailing Platforms
items.description: Joint optimization of pricing and matching in two-sided rideshare markets.

items.name: Surge Pricing Solves the Wild Goose Chase
items.description: Empirical analysis of Uber's surge pricing showing welfare improvements from reduced search frictions.

items.name: The Value of Flexible Work: Evidence from Uber Drivers
items.description: Estimates labor supply elasticity and value of flexibility using Uber driver data.

items.name: Economics of a Bottleneck
items.description: The workhorse model for dynamic congestion pricing theory—operationalized Vickrey's bottleneck concept with endogenous departure decisions and time-varying tolls.

items.name: Platform Competition in Two-Sided Markets
items.description: The foundational paper on two-sided market pricing—derives optimal price allocation explaining why platforms price asymmetrically across sides.

items.name: Competition in Two-Sided Markets
items.description: Introduces the competitive bottlenecks framework where one side multi-homes—explains monopoly power over access to single-homing customers.

items.name: Personalized Pricing and Consumer Welfare
items.description: Analyzes welfare effects of machine learning-based personalized pricing.

items.name: Algorithmic Pricing and Competition
items.description: How algorithmic pricing affects competition and market outcomes.

items.name: Customer Poaching and Brand Switching
items.description: The seminal paper on behavior-based price discrimination—foundational duopoly model showing how firms use purchase history to discriminate. 2,000+ citations.

items.name: The Economics of Privacy
items.description: The definitive JEL survey on privacy and personal data economics—covers consumer tracking, welfare implications, and regulatory frameworks.

items.name: Approximating Purchase Propensities and Reservation Prices from Broad Consumer Tracking
items.description: Key paper demonstrating ML enables first-degree price discrimination—shows big data increases potential profits by 14.55% vs 0.14% from demographics alone.

items.name: Automobile Prices in Market Equilibrium (BLP)
items.description: The foundational random coefficients discrete choice model for demand estimation.

items.name: Empirical Models of Consumer Behavior
items.description: Practical guide to implementing BLP-style demand models with market-level data.

items.name: pyBLP: BLP Demand Estimation in Python
items.description: Modern implementation and extensions of BLP with diagnostics and best practices.

items.name: Estimating Discrete-Choice Models of Product Differentiation
items.description: The foundational paper introducing the critical inversion technique for demand estimation—enables estimation with IVs despite endogenous prices.

items.name: Differentiated Products Demand Systems from a Combination of Micro and Macro Data: The New Car Market
items.description: Pioneered combining micro-level consumer data with aggregate market shares—foundation for modern 'micro moments' approaches in pyBLP.

items.name: Dynamic Online Pricing with Incomplete Information Using Multi-Armed Bandit Experiments
items.description: The workhorse paper for online price experimentation—extends MAB algorithms to incorporate microeconomic choice theory. 43% profit improvements.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing Without Knowing the Demand Function: Risk Bounds and Near-Optimal Algorithms
items.description: Field-defining paper establishing theoretical framework for dynamic pricing with demand learning. Pioneered regret-based analysis with √T regret bounds.

items.name: Simultaneously Learning and Optimizing Using Controlled Variance Pricing
items.description: Introduces elegant Controlled Variance Pricing (CVP) policy with 'taboo interval' for exploration. Achieves logarithmic regret while being highly implementable.

items.name: Online Network Revenue Management Using Thompson Sampling
items.description: Bridges bandit algorithms and practical pricing by applying Thompson sampling to network revenue management with inventory constraints. Validated at Rue La La.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing and Demand Learning with Limited Price Experimentation
items.description: Models settings where sellers can make at most m price changes. Characterizes optimal regret as O(log^m T). Includes real implementation at Groupon.

items.name: Feature-Based Dynamic Pricing
items.description: Pioneering work on contextual pricing where products have feature vectors. Uses ellipsoid method to achieve O(d² log d) regret. Winner of 2024 Revenue Management Prize.

items.name: A Disneyland Dilemma: Two-Part Tariffs for a Mickey Mouse Monopoly
items.description: Foundational paper on two-part tariffs. Should Disneyland charge high admission with free rides, or free entry with high per-ride prices? 600+ citations.

items.name: Multiproduct Nonlinear Pricing
items.description: Extends nonlinear pricing theory to multidimensional screening with multiple products. Foundational for product line design.

items.name: Nonlinear Pricing with Random Participation
items.description: Landmark paper showing that sufficiently intense competition eliminates quality distortions, yielding efficient 'cost-plus-fee' pricing.

items.name: Selling to Overconfident Consumers
items.description: Field-defining paper on behavioral pricing and three-part tariffs. Shows consumer overconfidence explains cell phone plan structures. Uses real cellular billing data.

items.name: Freemium as Optimal Menu Pricing
items.description: Rigorous foundations for freemium models (Spotify, YouTube). Shows optimal menu consists of exactly two services—ad-supported free and ad-free premium.

items.name: Artificial Intelligence, Algorithmic Pricing, and Collusion
items.description: Field-defining paper showing Q-learning algorithms autonomously learn supracompetitive prices without communication, sustaining collusion through punishment strategies.

items.name: Autonomous Algorithmic Collusion: Q-learning Under Sequential Pricing
items.description: Extends Calvano et al. to sequential (Stackelberg) pricing environments, showing Q-learning converges to collusive equilibria even with turn-taking.

items.name: Competition in Pricing Algorithms
items.description: Shows pricing algorithms generate supracompetitive prices through competitive equilibrium—no collusion required. Uses high-frequency empirical data from online retailers.

items.name: The Economics of Privacy
items.description: Definitive JEL survey on privacy economics—essential for understanding personalized pricing and price discrimination enabled by algorithmic data collection.

items.name: Sustainable and Unchallenged Algorithmic Tacit Collusion
items.description: Leading competition law analysis explaining the legal gap: tacit collusion is harmful but lawful under current antitrust frameworks.

items.name: A Tutorial on Thompson Sampling
items.description: Definitive reference on Thompson sampling covering Bernoulli bandits, product recommendation, assortment optimization, and RL in MDPs.

items.name: Thompson Sampling for Contextual Bandits with Linear Payoffs
items.description: First theoretical regret guarantees for contextual Thompson Sampling. Proves Õ(d√T) regret bounds. Novel martingale-based analysis became the template for subsequent work.

items.name: Dynamic Pricing Under a General Parametric Choice Model
items.description: Shows Θ(√T) regret for general parametric demand with MLE estimation. Important bridge between econometric demand estimation and online learning theory.

items.name: Reinforcement Learning Applied to Airline Revenue Management
items.description: Landmark industry application from Amadeus. Demonstrates deep RL for airline pricing that learns directly from customer interactions without demand forecasting.

items.name: Customer Churn Prediction: A Survey
items.description: Comprehensive survey of churn prediction methods and evaluation metrics.

items.name: Churn Prediction in Mobile Social Games: Towards a Complete Assessment Using Survival Ensembles
items.description: Survival analysis approach to churn with right-censoring and dynamic hazards.

items.name: Counting Your Customers: Who Are They and What Will They Do Next? (BG/NBD)
items.description: The BG/NBD model for customer lifetime value with transaction data.

items.name: 'Counting Your Customers' the Easy Way: An Alternative to the Pareto/NBD Model
items.description: Simplified BG/NBD model that maintains predictive accuracy with easier estimation.

items.name: Customer-Base Valuation in a Contractual Setting: The Perils of Ignoring Heterogeneity
items.description: Shifted-Beta-Geometric model for subscription businesses with discrete renewal periods.

items.name: Freemium as a Marketing Strategy
items.description: Structural model of freemium conversion analyzing optimal feature restriction.

items.name: Making Freemium Work
items.description: Practitioner framework for freemium strategy and conversion optimization.

items.name: Does Retaining Customers Pay Off?
items.description: Empirical analysis of the relationship between customer tenure and profitability.

items.name: The Effects of Customer Satisfaction on Customer Spending
items.description: Links satisfaction metrics to retention and share of wallet outcomes.

items.name: A Behavior Model for Persuasive Design
items.description: Foundational paper introducing the Fogg Behavior Model: Behavior = Motivation × Ability × Trigger. The academic framework underlying 'Hooked' and most digital habit formation research. Over 4,500 citations; essential conceptual foundation for product designers.

items.name: Does Gamification Work? — A Literature Review of Empirical Studies on Gamification
items.description: Seminal literature review establishing empirical evidence framework for gamification effects. Finds gamification provides positive effects on engagement but is highly context-dependent. Over 4,000 citations; the definitive academic synthesis on gamification.

items.name: Measuring the Impact of Crowdsourcing Features on Mobile App User Engagement and Retention: A Randomized Field Experiment
items.description: Rigorous RCT examining how user-generated content features affect app engagement. Finds content submission reduces session-ending hazard by 11% and app abandonment by 14%. Methodological gold standard for engagement research.

items.name: Digital Interventions and Habit Formation in Educational Technology
items.description: Large-scale randomized experiment (10,000 learners) showing contest-based interventions increase engagement by 45% and create persistent habit formation effects (75% higher engagement 12 weeks post-intervention). Cutting-edge field experimental evidence from leading economists.

items.name: Empirical Support for a Causal Relationship Between Gamification and Learning Outcomes
items.description: Provides causal evidence linking gamification to outcomes mediated by behavioral changes. Validates Landers' theory of gamified learning with empirical evidence—important for understanding mechanism design.

items.name: Customer Attrition Analysis for Financial Services Using Proportional Hazard Models
items.description: Comprehensive Cox proportional hazards application to customer churn with time-varying covariates. Demonstrates how demographic, environmental, and behavioral variables predict retention. Over 600 citations; foundational for survival analysis in marketing.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions

items.name: How to Project Customer Retention
items.description: Develops the shifted-beta-geometric (sBG) probability model for contractual settings. Accounts for customer heterogeneity in retention rates and provides forecasts for tenure, lifetime value, and customer base valuation. Essential methodology for subscription businesses.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions

items.name: A Competing Risks Model Based on Latent Dirichlet Allocation for Predicting Churn Reasons
items.description: Novel competing risks survival model predicting both churn propensity and churn reason. Incorporates text analytics (LDA) from customer service transcripts to distinguish service-provider-driven versus competitor-driven churn. Modern integration of NLP with survival analysis.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions

items.name: Random Survival Forests with Competing Risks Framework
items.description: Combines machine learning (random forests) with competing risks methodology. Computes distinct risk profiles for different churn causes and identifies relationships between risks and customer behavior for targeted interventions.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions

items.name: Manage Marketing by the Customer Equity Test
items.description: Introduces the customer equity concept and decision calculus for balancing acquisition versus retention spending. Origins of viewing customers as assets. Over 1,000 citations; bridges practitioner and academic perspectives.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Customer Base Analysis & Cohort Methods

items.name: Return on Marketing: Using Customer Equity to Focus Marketing Strategy
items.description: Unified strategic framework enabling marketing options to be traded off based on projected financial return, operationalized as change in customer equity. Key contribution linking marketing decisions to shareholder value through customer equity.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Customer Base Analysis & Cohort Methods

items.name: Valuing Customers
items.description: Demonstrates how CLV can value firms including high-growth firms with negative earnings. Shows 1% improvement in retention improves firm value by 3-7%, while margin improvement yields only ~1% increase. Validated on Amazon, eBay, Capital One, E*Trade data.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Customer Base Analysis & Cohort Methods

items.name: Social Effects on Customer Retention
items.description: Landmark study using data from 1 million cellular customers showing exposure to a defecting neighbor increases churn hazard by 80%. Establishes that social contagion affects retention similarly to adoption. Foundational paper for network effects on churn.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention

items.name: Social Interactions in Customer Churn Decisions: The Impact of Relationship Directionality
items.description: Extends social effects research by analyzing directed networks. Finds that only contacts the customer initiates communication with influence churn decisions. Demonstrates importance of relationship directionality and recency of neighbor churn.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention

items.name: Exploring Peer Effects Associated with User Retention in a Socially Connected Business
items.description: Uses gym membership data to study bidirectional peer effects in usage and churn. When high-centrality users churn, cascade effects increase average un-subscription by 7.2% within 6 months. Provides targeting guidance: short-term strategies should target low-centrality users; long-term should target high-centrality.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention

items.name: In Pursuit of Enhanced Customer Retention Management: Review, Key Issues, and Future Directions
items.description: Comprehensive review from 12 leading CRM scholars covering social connectivity's role in retention. Synthesizes literature on network externalities in multiplayer gaming, communications, and shared services. Identifies research frontier for network-oriented retention.
items.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention

items.name: Internet Advertising and the Generalized Second-Price Auction
items.description: Analysis of the GSP auction used by Google and the gap from VCG efficiency.

items.name: Position Auctions
items.description: Equilibrium analysis of position auctions with symmetric Nash equilibrium characterization.

items.name: Auctions and Bidding: A Guide for Computer Scientists
items.description: Comprehensive survey of auction theory and mechanism design for practitioners.

items.name: Counterspeculation, Auctions, and Competitive Sealed Tenders
items.description: Nobel Prize-winning paper establishing truthful bidding in second-price sealed-bid auctions—the theoretical bedrock for all VCG mechanisms and modern ad auctions. ~8,000 citations.

items.name: Optimal Auction Design
items.description: Derives revenue-maximizing auctions and optimal reserve prices via 'virtual value' concept. Essential for understanding how platforms set reserve prices. ~6,400 citations.

items.name: Budget Management Strategies in Repeated Auctions
items.description: Optimal budget pacing strategies for advertisers in repeated auctions.

items.name: Autobidding with Constraints
items.description: Value-maximizing autobidding under budget and ROI constraints.

items.name: From First-Price Auctions to Incentive-Compatible Auctions
items.description: Mechanism design for autobidders and the transition to first-price auctions.

items.name: Learning in Repeated Auctions with Budgets: Regret Minimization and Equilibrium
items.description: Introduces adaptive pacing strategies with asymptotic optimality proofs; shows these form approximate Nash equilibrium. The reference paper for budget pacing algorithms at Google/Meta.

items.name: Multiplicative Pacing Equilibria in Auction Markets
items.description: Formalizes pacing equilibrium as game-theoretic solution concept for autobidding; proves existence when platforms use multiplicative bid scaling.

items.name: Pacing Equilibrium in First Price Auction Markets
items.description: Theoretical justification for industry's transition to first-price auctions (Google 2019); proves unique equilibrium and efficient computation via Eisenberg-Gale program.

items.name: Measuring Ad Effectiveness Using Geo Experiments
items.description: Google's framework for measuring incremental ad impact using geographic experiments.

items.name: Ghost Ads: Improving the Economics of Measuring Online Ad Effectiveness
items.description: Novel methodology for measuring ad lift without holdout using predicted ad exposure.

items.name: Challenges and Opportunities in Media Mix Modeling
items.description: Google's approach to marketing mix modeling with Bayesian methods.

items.name: Consumer Heterogeneity and Paid Search Effectiveness: A Large-Scale Field Experiment
items.description: Landmark eBay experiment showing paid search ROI vastly overestimated—99.5% of brand keyword traffic substitutes to organic. Demonstrates critical importance of experiments over observational methods. ~800 citations.

items.name: The Unfavorable Economics of Measuring the Returns to Advertising
items.description: Analyzes 25 large RCTs ($2.8M spend) showing massive sample sizes needed for reliable ad measurement due to individual sales volatility (CV of 10). Explains why selection bias is 'crippling.' ~700 citations.

items.name: A Comparison of Approaches to Advertising Measurement: Evidence from Big Field Experiments at Facebook
items.description: Compares RCTs to observational methods using 15 Facebook experiments (1.6B impressions). Demonstrates observational methods consistently fail even with rich behavioral data. ~500 citations.

items.name: TV Advertising Effectiveness and Profitability: Generalizable Results from 288 Brands
items.description: Border-strategy identification across 288 brands finds TV ad elasticity of ~0.025—much lower than prior estimates; 80%+ of brands show negative marginal ROI.

items.name: A Large Scale Benchmark for Uplift Modeling
items.description: Criteo's uplift modeling benchmark and methods for targeting persuadables.

items.name: Targeting Online Display Ads: Comparing Segment-Based and Individual-Based Targeting
items.description: Compares effectiveness of behavioral vs. segment-based ad targeting.

items.name: An Experimental Investigation of the Effects of Retargeted Advertising: The Role of Frequency and Timing
items.description: Large-scale RCT showing retargeting increases website returns by 14.6%, with effectiveness decaying over time (33% of impact on day 1) and advertising complementarities across weeks.

items.name: Targeting and Privacy in Mobile Advertising
items.description: Unified framework combining ML-based targeting with auction models; shows efficient targeting improves CTR by 66.8% over current practice, with implications for privacy regulation.

items.name: Personalization in Email Marketing: The Role of Noninformative Advertising Content
items.description: Field experiments showing adding recipient names increases open rates by 20%, sales leads by 31%—even though names are non-informative. Gary Lilien Prize Finalist.

items.name: The Long and the Short of It: Balancing Short and Long-Term Marketing Strategies
items.description: IPA research on optimal balance between brand building and activation.

items.name: Online Display Advertising: Targeting and Obtrusiveness
items.description: Trade-offs between ad targeting precision and user annoyance.

items.name: Digital Advertising and Consumer Price Search
items.description: How digital advertising affects consumer search behavior and market outcomes.

items.name: How Well Does Advertising Work? Generalizations from Meta-Analysis of Brand Advertising Elasticities
items.description: Definitive meta-analysis of 751 short-term and 402 long-term advertising elasticities from 56 studies (1960-2008). Average short-term elasticity: 0.12; long-term: 0.24. ~440 citations.

items.name: How TV Advertising Works: A Meta-Analysis of 389 Real World Split Cable TV Advertising Experiments
items.description: Classic BehaviorScan meta-analysis showing only ~50% of TV ad weight tests had positive sales effects; established that copy/strategy changes matter more than budget increases. Foundational paper.

items.name: Privacy Regulation and Online Advertising
items.description: Foundational empirical paper showing EU privacy regulation (ePrivacy Directive) reduced display ad effectiveness by 65% in changing purchase intent. ~2,500 citations.

items.name: The Effect of Privacy Regulation on the Data Industry: Empirical Evidence from GDPR
items.description: Shows GDPR's opt-in led to 12.5% drop in tracked consumers, but remaining consumers are more valuable—demonstrating 'privacy externalities' where privacy-conscious consumers make opt-in consumers more predictable.

items.name: Privacy and Market Concentration: Intended and Unintended Consequences of the GDPR
items.description: Panel data on 27,000+ websites shows GDPR reduced vendor use by 15% but increased market concentration by 17%—large platforms (Google, Facebook) gained share as small vendors dropped.

items.name: The Economic Consequences of Apple's App Tracking Transparency
items.description: Quantifies ATT's economic effects: 37% reduction in CTR for Meta's conversion-optimized ads; firms with higher Meta dependence experienced 37% revenue decline. Smaller e-commerce firms disproportionately harmed.

items.name: Economic Consequences of Online Tracking Restrictions
items.description: Studies 128M ad impressions over 2.5 years; average cookie lifetime is 279 days with €2.52 value. One-year cookie restrictions would cost €904M annually in Europe. IJRM Best Article Award 2024.

items.name: Online Display Advertising Markets: A Literature Review and Future Directions
items.description: Comprehensive literature review organizing display advertising research by ecosystem agents (advertisers, publishers, intermediaries). Essential reading for understanding the programmatic landscape. ~200 citations.

items.name: Repeated Auctions with Budgets in Ad Exchanges: Approximations and Design
items.description: Introduces Fluid Mean Field Equilibrium (FMFE) framework for budget-constrained advertisers; provides prescriptions for reserve prices and impression allocation. ~500 citations.

items.name: Real-Time Bidding in Online Display Advertising
items.description: Game-theoretic model showing symmetric advertisers use asymmetric strategies; publishers should maintain reservation contracts alongside RTB for revenue optimization.

items.name: First-Price Auctions in Online Display Advertising
items.description: Explains industry shift from second-price to first-price auctions as direct economic consequence of header bidding adoption, not trust issues. Analyzes waterfalling vs. header bidding mechanisms.

items.name: Market Provision of Broadcasting: A Welfare Analysis
items.description: Foundational two-sided market model for advertising-financed media; analyzes when equilibrium advertising levels are socially optimal. The theoretical foundation for attention economics. ~680 citations.

items.name: How Viewer Tuning, Presence, and Attention Respond to Ad Content and Predict Brand Search Lift
items.description: First study distinguishing TV ad viewability from actual viewing using passive measurement; finds 30% of TV ads play to empty rooms. Demonstrates attention metrics predict brand search lift better than tuning data.

items.name: Television Advertising and Online Word-of-Mouth: An Empirical Investigation of Social TV Activity
items.description: Examines 'Social TV'—joint consumption of TV and social media production. TV advertising impacts online WOM volume for both brands and programs. ~200 citations.

items.name: Sponsorship Disclosure and Consumer Deception: Experimental Evidence from Native Advertising
items.description: Field experiments on how native advertising disclosure affects consumer behavior; provides causal evidence on tension between ad effectiveness and consumer deception in native formats.

items.name: The Dynamics of Viral Marketing
items.description: Empirical analysis of viral cascades on a retailer's recommendation network; foundational for understanding k-factor and referral mechanics.

items.name: Effects of Word-of-Mouth Versus Traditional Marketing
items.description: VAR model showing WOM elasticity is 20-30x higher than traditional marketing channels.

items.name: A Multi-Stage Model of Word-of-Mouth Influence
items.description: Decomposes viral influence across awareness, interest, and decision stages; practical framework for campaign design.

items.name: Referral Programs and Customer Value
items.description: Referred customers are 16% more valuable with higher margins and retention. Foundational empirical study on referral program economics. ~1,600 citations.

items.name: Seeding Strategies for Viral Marketing: An Empirical Comparison
items.description: Field experiments show hub/bridge seeding outperforms random targeting for viral campaigns. ~1,400 citations.

items.name: Creating Social Contagion Through Viral Product Design: A Randomized Trial of Peer Influence in Networks
items.description: Randomized trial on 1.4M Facebook users; passive-broadcast generates 246% more contagion than active-personalized messaging. ~1,800 citations.

items.name: Network Externalities, Competition, and Compatibility
items.description: Seminal formalization of direct/indirect network effects and compatibility choice; 6,800+ citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: A Theory of Interdependent Demand for a Communications Service
items.description: Original network effects paper introducing critical mass concept for telecommunications.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: Systems Competition and Network Effects
items.description: Accessible synthesis on network effects, installed base dynamics, and platform competition.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: Standardization, Compatibility, and Innovation
items.description: Introduces 'excess inertia' and coordination failure; explains why inferior standards persist.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: Platform Competition in Two-Sided Markets
items.description: THE foundational two-sided markets paper; pricing structure, chicken-and-egg dynamics. ~8,000 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: Competition in Two-Sided Markets
items.description: Introduces competitive bottlenecks—when one side multi-homes, platforms compete fiercely on single-homers. ~4,500 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: Chicken and Egg: Competition Among Intermediation Service Providers
items.description: Formalizes platform launch problem; divide-and-conquer strategies for entrants. ~1,800 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Network Effects & Viral Growth

items.name: How Promotions Work
items.description: 14 empirical generalizations about promotion effects (brand switching, stockpiling, category expansion); most-cited promotion paper.

items.name: The Different Faces of Coupon Elasticity
items.description: Econometric model for coupon effects showing self/cross-coupon elasticities; practical for optimization.

items.name: How Price Promotions Work: A Review
items.description: Comprehensive update to 1995 generalizations; bridges academic research with practitioner insights.

items.name: The Long-Term Impact of Promotion and Advertising on Consumer Brand Choice
items.description: 8-year panel showing promotions increase price sensitivity while eroding brand equity. ~2,500 citations.

items.name: A Price Discrimination Theory of Coupons
items.description: Foundational theory: coupons as self-selection price discrimination devices. ~1,800 citations.

items.name: Bayesian Methods for Media Mix Modeling with Carryover and Shape Effects
items.description: Foundational Google paper introducing Bayesian MMM with adstock/saturation curves; basis for LightweightMMM.

items.name: Geo-Level Bayesian Hierarchical Media Mix Modeling
items.description: Extends Bayesian MMM to geo-level data; provides tighter credible intervals and reduces targeting bias.

items.name: Robyn: Continuous & Semi-Automated MMM
items.description: Technical documentation for Meta's open-source Robyn; covers ridge regression, evolutionary optimization, calibration.

items.name: Media Mix Model Calibration With Bayesian Priors
items.description: Methods for calibrating MMM with experiment results; bridges MMM and incrementality testing.

items.name: The Persistence of Marketing Effects on Sales
items.description: Introduces persistence modeling via unit-roots and impulse response; distinguishes short-term from permanent effects. ~2,200 citations.

items.name: How Budget Allocation Relates to Productivity in Marketing Spending: An International Comparison
items.description: INFORMS Practice Prize winner; 1-4% profit improvement from optimized allocation vs. heuristics. ~650 citations.

items.name: Effect of Sales Promotion on Purchasing Behavior on Promotional and Non-Promotional Days
items.description: Promotions have virtually no permanent effects—short-term ROI metrics mislead. ~1,200 citations.

items.name: Differential Response Analysis
items.description: Original uplift paper introducing the 'Persuadables' segmentation framework (Persuadables, Sure Things, Lost Causes, Sleeping Dogs).

items.name: Using Control Groups to Target on Predicted Lift
items.description: Introduces Qini curves for uplift model evaluation; practitioner-focused methodology comparison.

items.name: Estimation and Inference of Heterogeneous Treatment Effects using Random Forests
items.description: Causal forests for HTE estimation with valid confidence intervals; foundation for grf package; 2000+ citations.

items.name: Decision Trees for Uplift Modeling
items.description: Adapts information theory for uplift decision trees; extends to multiple treatments; widely implemented.

items.name: Metalearners for Estimating Heterogeneous Treatment Effects Using Machine Learning
items.description: Introduces S-learner, T-learner, and X-learner; optimal for imbalanced treatment groups. ~1,100 citations.

items.name: Double/Debiased Machine Learning for Treatment and Structural Parameters
items.description: Foundation for causal ML—Neyman-orthogonal scores + cross-fitting enable root-n consistent inference. ~4,000 citations.

items.name: Towards Optimal Doubly Robust Estimation of Heterogeneous Causal Effects
items.description: DR-learner with minimax optimality bounds for heterogeneous effects. ~100+ citations.

items.name: Attributing Conversions in a Multichannel Online Marketing Environment: An Empirical Model and a Field Experiment
items.description: Bayesian multi-touch attribution with carryover/spillover across funnel stages; AMA/MSI Paul Root Award. ~600 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Customer Journey & Funnel Analytics

items.name: Understanding Customer Experience Throughout the Customer Journey
items.description: Seminal conceptual framework for touchpoints across pre-purchase, purchase, post-purchase. ~3,500 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Customer Journey & Funnel Analytics

items.name: Challenges and Opportunities in Multichannel Customer Management
items.description: Foundational 5-challenge framework for omnichannel research. ~2,000 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Customer Journey & Funnel Analytics

items.name: Mapping the Customer Journey: Lessons Learned from Graph-Based Online Attribution Modeling
items.description: Markov chain attribution showing substantial divergence from last-click heuristics. ~350 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Customer Journey & Funnel Analytics

items.name: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments: A Practical Guide to A/B Testing
items.description: Foundational best practices from thousands of experiments at Microsoft/Amazon; OEC design, validity threats. ~1,200 citations.

items.name: Graph Cluster Randomization: Network Exposure to Multiple Universes
items.description: Handles network interference via cluster randomization; exponentially lower variance under spillovers. ~600 citations.

items.name: An Empirical Evaluation of Thompson Sampling
items.description: Establishes Thompson Sampling as practical standard for explore-exploit in ad optimization. ~1,500 citations.

items.name: Always Valid Inference: Continuous Monitoring of A/B Tests
items.description: Defines always-valid p-values maintaining validity regardless of peeking; solves continuous monitoring problem. ~400 citations.

items.name: Inferring Causal Impact Using Bayesian Structural Time-Series Models
items.description: CausalImpact methodology for geo-experiments when individual randomization impossible. ~1,400 citations.

items.name: The Endowed Progress Effect: How Artificial Advancement Increases Effort
items.description: Artificial progress (pre-stamped cards) significantly increases completion; foundational loyalty psychology. ~1,800 citations.

items.name: The Mismanagement of Customer Loyalty
items.description: Framework identifying controllable CLV drivers; outperforms RFM models. ~2,400 citations.

items.name: Do Loyalty Programs Really Enhance Behavioral Loyalty? An Empirical Analysis Accounting for Self-Selecting Members
items.description: IV correction shows 86% of apparent LP effect disappears when controlling for self-selection. ~900 citations.

items.name: Long-Term Impact of Loyalty Programs on Consumer Purchase Behavior and Loyalty
items.description: Heterogeneous effects: heavy buyers don't change; light buyers benefit most from programs. ~1,400 citations.

items.name: The Effect of Word of Mouth on Sales: Online Book Reviews
items.description: Causal evidence reviews affect sales; 1-star reviews hurt more than 5-star help. ~4,500 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Content & Social Media Marketing

items.name: What Makes Online Content Viral?
items.description: High-arousal emotions (awe, anger) increase sharing; positive content more viral. ~3,500 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Content & Social Media Marketing

items.name: Using Online Conversations to Study Word-of-Mouth Communication
items.description: WOM dispersion (not volume) predicts growth; conversations across communities matter most. ~2,200 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Content & Social Media Marketing

items.name: Influencer Marketing Effectiveness
items.description: 5,800+ campaigns: originality, follower size, sponsor salience enhance effectiveness; inverted-U for activity. ~300 citations.
items.category: Marketing & Growth > Content & Social Media Marketing

items.name: Matrix Factorization Techniques for Recommender Systems
items.description: The definitive Netflix Prize paper establishing matrix factorization as the dominant CF paradigm.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: Collaborative Filtering for Implicit Feedback Datasets
items.description: Foundational paper for implicit feedback (clicks, views); introduces confidence-weighted MF with ALS optimization.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: BPR: Bayesian Personalized Ranking from Implicit Feedback
items.description: Standard pairwise ranking loss for implicit feedback; BPR-OPT criterion ubiquitous in modern training.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: Factorization Meets the Neighborhood
items.description: Combines neighborhood and latent factor models; integrates user/item biases; essential for blending approaches.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: Probabilistic Matrix Factorization
items.description: Introduced probabilistic treatment of MF that scales linearly with observations; handles Netflix-scale sparsity with automatic regularization via adaptive priors.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: Factorization Machines
items.description: General predictor combining SVM flexibility with factorization model power; models all pairwise feature interactions in linear time. Subsumes SVD++, PITF, and specialized models.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: Collaborative Filtering with Temporal Dynamics
items.description: TimeSVD++ explicitly models drifting user preferences, item popularity evolution, and time-varying biases. Core component of Netflix Prize winning solution.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Collaborative Filtering & Matrix Factorization

items.name: Deep Neural Networks for YouTube Recommendations
items.description: Seminal industry paper establishing two-stage deep learning (candidate generation + ranking) at billion-scale.

items.name: Embedding-based Retrieval in Facebook Search
items.description: Comprehensive industry paper on two-tower embedding models; covers hard negative mining, ANN indexing, production deployment.

items.name: Self-Attentive Sequential Recommendation (SASRec)
items.description: Applies self-attention to sequential recommendations; the Transformer foundation inspiring BERT4Rec and modern sequential models.

items.name: BERT4Rec: Sequential Recommendation with BERT
items.description: Adapts BERT's bidirectional self-attention with Cloze task for sequential predictions.

items.name: Neural Collaborative Filtering
items.description: Replaces inner product with neural networks; introduces GMF+MLP framework (NeuMF); highly cited baseline.

items.name: Wide & Deep Learning for Recommender Systems
items.description: Jointly trains wide linear models (memorization) with deep networks (generalization) using shared embeddings. Productionized on Google Play for 1B+ users; seminal industry paper establishing wide+deep paradigm.

items.name: DeepFM: A Factorization-Machine based Neural Network for CTR Prediction
items.description: Combines FM component (low-order interactions) with deep component (high-order) via shared embeddings. Unlike Wide&Deep, requires no manual feature engineering. End-to-end training.

items.name: Deep Interest Network for Click-Through Rate Prediction
items.description: Attention mechanism adaptively learns user interest representations from behavioral history relative to candidate items—solving fixed-length embedding bottleneck. Deployed on Alibaba main traffic.

items.name: Recommendations as Treatments: Debiasing Learning and Evaluation
items.description: Foundational paper applying causal inference to recommenders; introduces IPS-based unbiased estimators.

items.name: Unbiased Learning-to-Rank with Biased Feedback
items.description: Addresses position bias in click data; propensity-weighted ranking SVM; essential for implicit feedback.

items.name: The Self-Normalized Estimator for Counterfactual Learning
items.description: Introduces SNIPS reducing IPS variance without bias; widely used in production.

items.name: Counterfactual Learning and Evaluation for Recommender Systems
items.description: Comprehensive tutorial covering IPS, SNIPS, Doubly Robust estimators with implementation guidance.

items.name: Doubly Robust Joint Learning for Recommendation on Data Missing Not at Random
items.description: Combines imputation models with propensity scoring for unbiased performance estimation; theoretically principled doubly robust framework specifically for recommender systems with MNAR data.

items.name: Causal Embeddings for Recommendation
items.description: CausE optimizes recommendation policy for causal treatment effects (not just prediction) using domain adaptation to handle biased logged data. RecSys Best Paper Award.

items.name: The Deconfounded Recommender: A Causal Inference Approach to Recommendation
items.description: Two-stage approach using substitute confounders from exposure modeling; addresses unobserved confounding in observational recommendation data from principled causal perspective.

items.name: Topic Diversification for Recommendation Lists
items.description: Pioneering paper on balancing accuracy with diversity; introduces intra-list diversity metrics.

items.name: Exploring the Filter Bubble
items.description: First rigorous longitudinal study measuring filter bubble effects at individual level using MovieLens.

items.name: Blockbuster Culture's Next Rise or Fall
items.description: Analyzes how recommenders affect aggregate sales diversity (long tail vs. blockbusters).

items.name: Explore, Exploit, and Explain
items.description: Spotify's production system combining contextual bandits for exploration with explainable recommendations.

items.name: A Contextual-Bandit Approach to Personalized News Article Recommendation
items.description: Introduces LinUCB algorithm for contextual bandits; 12.5% CTR lift over context-free bandits on 33M+ Yahoo events. Foundational paper for bandit-based recommendations.

items.name: An Empirical Evaluation of Thompson Sampling
items.description: Comprehensive evaluation across display advertising and news recommendation demonstrating Thompson Sampling achieves state-of-the-art results; reignited practical interest in TS.

items.name: Calibrated Recommendations
items.description: Shows accuracy-optimized recommenders crowd out users' lesser interests; proposes KL-divergence calibration metrics and efficient greedy re-ranking. Netflix research, RecSys Best Paper Nominee.

items.name: DropoutNet: Addressing Cold Start in Recommender Systems
items.description: Uses dropout to force reliance on content features when collaborative signals unavailable; practical and widely adopted.

items.name: A Meta-Learning Perspective on Cold-Start Recommendations
items.description: Applies meta-learning to item cold-start; learns to adapt quickly from user history.

items.name: Collaborative Deep Learning for Recommender Systems
items.description: Combines deep learning for content (stacked denoising autoencoders) with CF; influential hybrid approach.

items.name: MeLU: Meta-Learned User Preference Estimator
items.description: Applies MAML framework to user cold-start; learns initialization that quickly adapts to new users.

items.name: From Zero-Shot Learning to Cold-Start Recommendation
items.description: First paper framing cold-start as zero-shot learning problem; proposes Low-rank Linear Auto-Encoder (LLAE) addressing domain shift and spurious correlations. Novel theoretical connection enabling attribute-based recommendations for entirely new users.

items.name: Transfer-Meta Framework for Cross-domain Recommendation to Cold-Start Users
items.description: State-of-the-art combining transfer learning and meta-learning for cross-domain cold start; uses source domain to warm-start target domain predictions for zero-interaction users.

items.name: PinSage: Graph Convolutional Neural Networks for Web-Scale Recommender Systems
items.description: First billion-scale GCN deployment. Random-walk neighborhood sampling, curriculum training with hard negatives, MapReduce inference for Pinterest's 3B node graph. Seminal industrial GNN paper.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Graph Neural Networks for Recommendations

items.name: Neural Graph Collaborative Filtering
items.description: First to explicitly encode collaborative signal via high-order connectivity on user-item bipartite graphs through embedding propagation. Foundational theoretical framework for GNN-based CF.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Graph Neural Networks for Recommendations

items.name: LightGCN: Simplifying and Powering Graph Convolution Network for Recommendation
items.description: Demonstrates feature transformation and nonlinear activation contribute little to CF; proposes simplified GCN using only neighborhood aggregation—16% improvement over NGCF with simpler architecture.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Graph Neural Networks for Recommendations

items.name: KGAT: Knowledge Graph Attention Network for Recommendation
items.description: Unifies user-item interaction graphs with knowledge graphs via attention-based neighbor discrimination; enables more accurate, diverse, and explainable recommendations.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Graph Neural Networks for Recommendations

items.name: Modeling Task Relationships in Multi-task Learning with Multi-gate Mixture-of-Experts
items.description: Task-specific gating networks over shared expert submodels; explicitly learns task relationships from data. Deployed at Google; widely adopted at Pinterest, LinkedIn, Meta.

items.name: Progressive Layered Extraction (PLE): A Novel Multi-Task Learning Model for Personalized Recommendations
items.description: Addresses 'seesaw phenomenon' where improving one task hurts others; explicitly separates shared/task-specific experts with progressive routing. Achieved 2.23% lift at Tencent.

items.name: Entire Space Multi-Task Model: An Effective Approach for Estimating Post-Click Conversion Rate
items.description: Models CVR over entire impression space (not just clicks) to eliminate sample selection bias; jointly trains CTR and CTCVR with shared embeddings. Alibaba/Taobao deployment.

items.name: A Pareto-Efficient Algorithm for Multiple Objective Optimization in E-Commerce Recommendation
items.description: PE-LTR framework using coordinate descent with theoretical Pareto efficiency guarantees for balancing CTR and GMV. Alibaba e-commerce production system.

items.name: Top-K Off-Policy Correction for a REINFORCE Recommender System
items.description: Scales REINFORCE to YouTube production with millions of items; introduces top-K off-policy correction for learning from biased logged feedback. Seminal industry RL paper.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Reinforcement Learning for Recommendations

items.name: SlateQ: A Tractable Decomposition for Reinforcement Learning with Recommendation Sets
items.description: Value-based RL decomposition for slate recommendations; long-term slate value decomposes into tractable item-wise LTVs. YouTube production deployment solving combinatorial slate optimization.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Reinforcement Learning for Recommendations

items.name: Deep Reinforcement Learning for List-wise Recommendations
items.description: Actor-Critic framework capturing inter-item relationships in list recommendations; addresses sequential decision-making for e-commerce. JD.com application.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Reinforcement Learning for Recommendations

items.name: Pseudo Dyna-Q: A Reinforcement Learning Framework for Interactive Recommendation
items.description: Model-based RL using world models for recommendation; addresses data efficiency challenge of learning from limited online interactions.
items.category: Recommender Systems > Reinforcement Learning for Recommendations

items.name: Fairness of Exposure in Rankings
items.description: Foundational framework for exposure-based fairness; develops efficient algorithms maximizing user utility while satisfying fairness constraints on content provider exposure. Applicable to job platforms, e-commerce, any two-sided marketplace.

items.name: Towards a Fair Marketplace: Counterfactual Evaluation of the Trade-off between Relevance, Fairness & Satisfaction
items.description: Studies relevance-fairness trade-offs in two-sided marketplaces; proposes counterfactual evaluation for balancing consumer and supplier objectives. Spotify production research.

items.name: Controlling Fairness and Bias in Dynamic Learning-to-Rank
items.description: Learning-to-rank enforcing merit-based fairness guarantees to item groups while accounting for selection bias in implicit feedback. Addresses fairness maintenance over time.

items.name: Recommendations and Their Impact on the Provider Side
items.description: Comprehensive study of how recommendations affect content providers; examines supplier-side impacts and multi-stakeholder trade-offs. Spotify research.

items.name: Offline A/B Testing for Recommender Systems
items.description: Counterfactual estimators for offline evaluation correlating with online A/B tests; addresses bias-variance tradeoffs in off-policy evaluation. Criteo production system enabling faster iteration.

items.name: Performance of Recommender Algorithms on Top-N Recommendation Tasks
items.description: Demonstrates RMSE optimization doesn't translate to top-N accuracy; establishes methodology for evaluating recommendation quality beyond prediction error metrics. Netflix context.

items.name: Are We Really Making Much Progress? A Worrying Analysis of Recent Neural Recommendation Approaches
items.description: Critical analysis showing many neural approaches don't outperform well-tuned baselines; emphasizes reproducibility and rigorous evaluation methodology. Essential for experimental design.

items.name: From RankNet to LambdaRank to LambdaMART: An Overview
items.description: Definitive reference unifying the RankNet family; LambdaMART remains the industry workhorse for gradient-boosted ranking.

items.name: Learning to Rank using Gradient Descent (RankNet)
items.description: Foundational pairwise neural ranking using cross-entropy loss; won ICML Test of Time Award 2015.

items.name: Learning to Rank: From Pairwise to Listwise (ListNet)
items.description: First listwise method using probability distributions over permutations; influenced all subsequent listwise methods.

items.name: Listwise Approach to Learning to Rank (ListMLE)
items.description: Foundational listwise LTR with theoretical analysis of listwise loss functions.

items.name: Optimizing Search Engines using Clickthrough Data
items.description: Seminal SVM-based pairwise LTR using click data for preference constraints; established click-based learning to rank paradigm.

items.name: Understanding User Goals in Web Search
items.description: Seminal taxonomy of query intent (navigational, informational, transactional); foundational framework still used today.

items.name: Building Bridges for Web Query Classification
items.description: Foundational work on mapping queries to topic categories using intermediary data sources.

items.name: Deep Search Query Intent Understanding
items.description: Industrial-scale BERT-based intent classification for typeahead and search blending.

items.name: Relevance-Based Language Models
items.description: Foundational pseudo-relevance feedback method introducing RM3; widely used for query expansion in both traditional and neural retrieval.

items.name: Context-Sensitive Information Retrieval Using Implicit Feedback
items.description: Pioneered use of session context for query interpretation; demonstrated significant gains from implicit user feedback.

items.name: Few-Shot Generative Conversational Query Rewriting
items.description: Modern neural query reformulation using GPT-2 for conversational settings; addresses context carryover in multi-turn search.

items.name: Deep Neural Networks for YouTube Recommendations
items.description: Landmark paper on watch-time optimization vs. clicks; explains freshness handling at scale.

items.name: Recommending What Video to Watch Next
items.description: Multi-objective ranking balancing engagement with satisfaction using multi-gate mixture-of-experts.

items.name: 150 Successful ML Models: 6 Lessons at Booking.com
items.description: Influential industry paper on balancing business metrics vs. user value in production systems.

items.name: Engagement, User Satisfaction, and Divisive Content Amplification
items.description: Demonstrates empirically that engagement-based ranking underperforms for user satisfaction.

items.name: Modeling Dwell Time to Predict Click-level Satisfaction
items.description: Established context-dependent satisfaction thresholds beyond fixed dwell time cutoffs; showed satisfaction prediction requires query-document context.

items.name: Beyond Clicks: Query Reformulation as a Predictor of Search Satisfaction
