items.description: Demonstrated satisfaction signals exist beyond clicks; query reformulation patterns predict user satisfaction better than clicks alone.

items.name: An Experimental Comparison of Click Position-Bias Models
items.description: Seminal empirical study establishing cascade model as best explanation for user examination behavior.

items.name: Unbiased Learning-to-Rank with Biased Feedback
items.description: Foundational counterfactual/IPS framework for unbiased LTR; propensity-weighted ranking SVM.

items.name: Click Models for Web Search
items.description: Comprehensive synthesis covering all major click models (PBM, DCM, DBN, UBM); essential reference.

items.name: Unbiased LTR with Unbiased Propensity Estimation (DLA)
items.description: Dual learning algorithm jointly training ranking and propensity models; widely used for production debiasing.

items.name: Improving Deep Learning for Airbnb Search
items.description: Practical industry case on position bias correction via dropout at inference; shows major production gains.

items.name: Addressing Trust Bias for Unbiased Learning-to-Rank
items.description: First rigorous treatment of trust bias in ULTR framework; extends counterfactual work to account for users trusting higher-ranked results more.

items.name: Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain QA (DPR)
items.description: Foundational dual-encoder dense retrieval; outperforms BM25 by 9-19%; established the dense retrieval paradigm.

items.name: ColBERT: Efficient Passage Search via Late Interaction
items.description: Introduced late interaction achieving near cross-encoder quality with bi-encoder speed.

items.name: Passage Re-ranking with BERT
items.description: Transformative demonstration of BERT for passage re-ranking; 27% improvement on MS MARCO.

items.name: Real-time Personalization using Embeddings at Airbnb
items.description: Best Paper Award. Production embedding system driving 99% of Airbnb conversions.

items.name: Sentence-BERT: Sentence Embeddings using Siamese Networks
items.description: Made BERT practical for dense retrieval with siamese architecture; widely used for semantic similarity.

items.name: SPLADE: Sparse Lexical and Expansion Model for First Stage Ranking
items.description: Learned sparse representations via MLM head with sparsity regularization; bridges gap between dense and sparse retrieval with interpretable term weights.

items.name: RocketQA: An Optimized Training Approach to Dense Passage Retrieval
items.description: Critical training strategies for dense retrieval: cross-batch negatives, denoised hard negatives, knowledge distillation from cross-encoder. Baidu research.

items.name: Approximate Nearest Neighbor Negative Contrastive Learning for Dense Text Retrieval
items.description: Global hard negative mining via ANN index (ANCE); addresses limitation of in-batch negatives by refreshing hard negatives from evolving model.

items.name: Multi-Stage Document Ranking with BERT
items.description: Established BERT-based cross-encoder reranking paradigm with MonoBERT and duoBERT; 'Expando-Mono-Duo' design pattern for neural IR pipelines.

items.name: From doc2query to docTTTTTquery
items.description: Neural document expansion via T5-generated queries; improves BM25 without runtime overhead by enriching documents at indexing time.

items.name: A Deep Relevance Matching Model for Ad-hoc Retrieval
items.description: Distinguished 'relevance matching' from 'semantic matching' in neural IR; histogram-based matching with term gating mechanism.

items.name: End-to-End Neural Ad-hoc Ranking with Kernel Pooling
items.description: Pioneered end-to-end neural ranking with interpretable soft-match kernels (K-NRM); spawned KNRM variants used in production.

items.name: Unsupervised Corpus Aware Language Model Pre-training for Dense Passage Retrieval
items.description: Pre-training specifically for dense retrieval via Condenser architecture; coCondenser adds corpus-aware contrastive objective for further gains.

items.name: REALM: Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training
items.description: First end-to-end pre-training of retrieval + LM with backpropagation through retrieval; foundational architecture for knowledge-intensive tasks.

items.name: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks
items.description: THE paper that coined 'RAG'; combines pre-trained retriever with seq2seq generator for open-domain QA. Foundation for modern RAG systems.

items.name: Leveraging Passage Retrieval with Generative Models for Open Domain Question Answering
items.description: Fusion-in-Decoder (FiD) architecture enabling efficient scaling to 100+ passages; backbone of Atlas and subsequent RAG systems.

items.name: Transformer Memory as a Differentiable Search Index
items.description: Generative retrieval paradigm (DSI): model memorizes corpus and generates document IDs directly; alternative to dense/sparse retrieve-then-rank.

items.name: Cumulated Gain-Based Evaluation of IR Techniques
items.description: Introduced DCG and NDCG; most widely used ranking metric enabling graded relevance evaluation.
items.category: Search & Ranking > Evaluation Methods for IR

items.name: Expected Reciprocal Rank for Graded Relevance
items.description: Cascade-based metric modeling user stopping behavior; primary TREC Web Track metric accounting for diminishing returns.
items.category: Search & Ranking > Evaluation Methods for IR

items.name: MS MARCO: A Human Generated MAchine Reading COmprehension Dataset
items.description: Large-scale passage ranking benchmark with 1M queries; enabled neural retrieval research and remains primary leaderboard.
items.category: Search & Ranking > Evaluation Methods for IR

items.name: BEIR: A Heterogeneous Benchmark for Zero-shot Evaluation of Information Retrieval Models
items.description: 18-dataset benchmark testing out-of-distribution generalization; key finding that BM25 remains robust while dense models struggle on domain shift.
items.category: Search & Ranking > Evaluation Methods for IR

items.name: Large-Scale Validation and Analysis of Interleaved Search Evaluation
items.description: Definitive validation of interleaving as online A/B testing gold standard; demonstrated high agreement with editorial judgments at scale.
items.category: Search & Ranking > Evaluation Methods for IR

items.name: Personalizing Search via Automated Analysis of Interests and Activities
items.description: Foundational personalization paper establishing paradigm for implicit user modeling from desktop and search history.

items.name: Modeling the Impact of Short- and Long-Term Behavior on Search Personalization
items.description: Established distinction between session-level and historical personalization signals; showed combination outperforms either alone.

items.name: Context-Aware Ranking in Web Search
items.description: Operationalized session and context signals in production LTR frameworks; showed how to integrate behavioral context into ranking features.

items.name: TREC CAsT 2019: The Conversational Assistance Track
items.description: Defining benchmark for conversational IR with 80 dialogues over 38M passages; established evaluation methodology for multi-turn search.

items.name: Open-Retrieval Conversational Question Answering
items.description: Open-domain retrieval for conversational QA; advances beyond simplified settings with ORConvQA dataset and baselines.

items.name: The Use of MMR, Diversity-Based Reranking for Reordering Documents and Producing Summaries
items.description: THE seminal diversification paper introducing Maximal Marginal Relevance (MMR) formula; balances relevance with novelty.

items.name: Novelty and Diversity in Information Retrieval Evaluation
items.description: Standard evaluation framework for diversity introducing α-nDCG; enabled TREC Web diversity track and systematic diversity research.

items.name: Diversifying Search Results
items.description: Intent-aware diversification with formal coverage guarantees; models query as distribution over intents and optimizes expected coverage.

items.name: Platform Competition in Two-Sided Markets
items.description: Foundational theory introducing price structure vs. price level distinction for platforms.

items.name: Two-Sided Markets: A Progress Report
items.description: Comprehensive survey defining two-sidedness by price structure; multi-homing analysis.

items.name: Competition in Two-Sided Markets
items.description: Three canonical models (monopoly, single-homing, competitive bottlenecks); workhorse for policy analysis.

items.name: Chicken and Egg: Competition Among Intermediation Service Providers
items.description: Addresses startup problem and price competition; divide-and-conquer strategies.

items.name: A Price Theory of Multi-Sided Platforms
items.description: The theoretical gold standard for platform pricing; introduces Spence distortion showing platforms internalize network effects only for marginal users. Essential for welfare analysis.

items.name: Pricing and Commitment by Two-Sided Platforms
items.description: Studies sequential arrival of sides and commitment decisions; key for understanding multi-homing dynamics and platform timing strategies.

items.name: Platform Envelopment
items.description: Explains how tech giants expand across adjacent platform markets through bundling; foundational for understanding winner-take-all dynamics.

items.name: Nobel Prize Scientific Background: DMP Model
items.description: Comprehensive summary of canonical search-matching theory; matching function, wage bargaining, unemployment dynamics.

items.name: Equilibrium Unemployment Theory
items.description: Definitive textbook treatment of DMP model; the practitioner's reference for labor market search.

items.name: Looking into the Black Box: A Survey of the Matching Function
items.description: Empirical estimation of aggregate matching functions; bridges theory and data.

items.name: Job Creation and Job Destruction
items.description: Introduces endogenous job destruction into search framework; stochastic equilibrium model.

items.name: Inefficient Hiring in Entry-Level Labor Markets
items.description: Field experiment on Upwork (oDesk) demonstrating information frictions cause inefficient unemployment; first rigorous platform labor experiment.

items.name: Landing the First Job: The Value of Intermediaries in Online Hiring
items.description: Uses Upwork data to quantify how platform certification helps inexperienced workers overcome reputation gaps and find first jobs.

items.name: Monopsony in Online Labor Markets
items.description: Amazon Mechanical Turk experiments find substantial monopsony power (labor supply elasticity ~0.1) facing individual requesters.

items.name: Who Benefits from Online Gig Economy Platforms?
items.description: Upwork analysis showing workers capture surplus because demand-side search frictions reduce direct competition between workers.

items.name: College Admissions and the Stability of Marriage
items.description: Introduces deferred acceptance algorithm and stability concept; foundation of market design.

items.name: Kidney Exchange
items.description: Applies mechanism design to organ allocation; created real kidney exchange programs; saves thousands of lives.

items.name: The Redesign of the Matching Market for American Physicians
items.description: Engineering economics: redesigning NRMP; demonstrates stability matters empirically.

items.name: Matching and Pricing in Ride Hailing: Wild Goose Chases
items.description: Shows ride-hailing prone to matching failures; explains why surge pricing is necessary.

items.name: Clearing Matching Markets Efficiently: Informative Signals and Match Recommendations
items.description: Shows platforms can facilitate efficient market clearing through targeted recommendations; reduces wasted applications and improves welfare for both sides.

items.name: Pricing in Ride-Sharing Platforms: A Queueing-Theoretic Approach
items.description: Foundational queueing model for Uber/Lyft showing dynamic pricing is robust to uncertainty; establishes theoretical foundation for surge pricing.

items.name: Trust Among Strangers in Internet Transactions
items.description: First rigorous empirical analysis of online reputation (eBay); documents extreme positive bias.

items.name: The Value of Reputation on eBay: A Controlled Experiment
items.description: Field experiment proving ~8% reputation premium; gold standard methodology.

items.name: Fake It Till You Make It: Reputation, Competition, and Yelp Review Fraud
items.description: Documents incentives for fake reviews; 16% of Yelp reviews suspicious; competition drives fraud.

items.name: Reciprocity and Unveiling in Two-Sided Reputation Systems
items.description: Airbnb experiment showing bilateral reviews cause reciprocity/retaliation bias.

items.name: The Limits of Reputation in Platform Markets: An Empirical Analysis and Field Experiment
items.description: eBay analysis showing reputation mechanisms suffer from reputational externalities and silent dissatisfaction bias; introduces 'Effective Percent Positive' measure.

items.name: Promotional Reviews: An Empirical Investigation of Online Review Manipulation
items.description: First rigorous fake review identification comparing TripAdvisor vs. Expedia; shows independent hotels strategically post fake reviews of competitors.

items.name: Asymmetric Information, Adverse Selection and Online Disclosure: The Case of eBay Motors
items.description: Classic on voluntary disclosure in online markets; shows sellers reveal private information to reduce adverse selection in used car sales.

items.name: Using Big Data to Estimate Consumer Surplus: The Case of Uber
items.description: Uses surge pricing variation to estimate demand; $6.8B consumer surplus; RDD methodology.

items.name: Who Benefits from Surge Pricing?
items.description: Structural model of surge pricing welfare; riders gain, drivers lose; distributional analysis.

items.name: Overbooking with Substitutable Inventory Classes
items.description: Optimal overbooking with multiple fare classes; airline revenue management workhorse.

items.name: Managing Congestion in Matching Markets
items.description: Shows restricting visibility reduces wasted applications and improves welfare for both sides; directly applicable to Upwork, dating apps, Airbnb.

items.name: Design of Lotteries and Wait-Lists for Affordable Housing Allocation
items.description: Proves equivalence of independent lotteries and penalty-waitlists; applicable to any platform managing queues for scarce resources.

items.name: An Analysis of the Labor Market for Uber's Driver-Partners in the United States
items.description: First comprehensive Uber labor market analysis using administrative and survey data; foundational descriptive paper on gig work.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Gig Economy & Platform Labor

items.name: The Value of Flexible Work: Evidence from Uber Drivers
items.description: Estimates drivers earn more than twice the surplus they would in rigid arrangements; seminal flexibility valuation paper.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Gig Economy & Platform Labor

items.name: Uber versus Taxi: A Driver's Eye View
items.description: Field experiment showing rideshare drivers strongly prefer proportional commission over fixed taxi leases; finds intertemporal substitution elasticity ~1.2.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Gig Economy & Platform Labor

items.name: The Gender Earnings Gap in the Gig Economy: Evidence from over a Million Rideshare Drivers
items.description: Documents 7% gender gap among Uber drivers entirely explained by experience, preferences, and driving speed—not discrimination.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Gig Economy & Platform Labor

items.name: Valuing Alternative Work Arrangements
items.description: Field experiment finding average worker WTP 20% of wages to avoid employer-set schedules; explains gig work appeal.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Gig Economy & Platform Labor

items.name: The Rise and Nature of Alternative Work Arrangements in the United States, 1995-2015
items.description: Documents alternative work growth from 10.7% to 15.8% of workforce; contextualizes gig economy scale and trends.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Gig Economy & Platform Labor

items.name: The Role of Surge Pricing on a Service Platform with Self-Scheduling Capacity
items.description: Foundational theory showing surge pricing benefits all stakeholders by better utilizing flexible capacity; explains when dynamic pricing is welfare-improving.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Dynamic Pricing in Marketplaces

items.name: Artificial Intelligence, Algorithmic Pricing, and Collusion
items.description: Demonstrates Q-learning algorithms autonomously learn collusive strategies; major antitrust implications for platform pricing.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Dynamic Pricing in Marketplaces

items.name: Algorithmic Pricing and Competition: Empirical Evidence from the German Retail Gasoline Market
items.description: First large-scale empirical analysis finding margins increased 28% when both competitors adopted pricing algorithms.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Dynamic Pricing in Marketplaces

items.name: Why Marketplace Experimentation is Harder than it Seems: The Role of Test-Control Interference
items.description: First paper documenting naive A/B testing overstates treatment effects by ~2x due to general equilibrium effects; eBay data, launched this literature.

items.name: The Econometrics of Randomized Experiments
items.description: Comprehensive treatment of experimental design including interference; essential methodology paper for platform economists.

items.name: Interference, Bias, and Variance in Two-Sided Marketplace Experimentation: Guidance for Platforms
items.description: Characterizes when to randomize on supply vs. demand side; practical guidance for platforms running experiments.

items.name: Reducing Interference Bias in Online Marketplace Experiments Using Cluster Randomization
items.description: Meta-experiment on Airbnb empirically measuring interference bias magnitude; bridges theory and practice for marketplace experiments.

items.name: Search, Matching, and the Role of Digital Marketplace Design in Enabling Trade: Evidence from Airbnb
items.description: Shows 42% of booking inquiries rejected by hosts; platform search design critically affects transaction volume and market thickness.

items.name: Responses to Entry in Multi-Sided Markets: The Impact of Craigslist on Local Newspapers
items.description: Exploits Craigslist's staggered entry; landmark empirical paper on platform competition and displacement effects.

items.name: Competing with Complementors: An Empirical Look at Amazon.com
items.description: Amazon Marketplace data showing Amazon targets successful product spaces for entry; essential for self-preferencing debates.

items.name: The Rise of the Sharing Economy: Estimating the Impact of Airbnb on the Hotel Industry
items.description: Estimates 8-10% causal impact on hotel revenue in Austin; shows sharing economy disruption dynamics and incumbent responses.

items.name: Trust and Disintermediation: Evidence from an Online Freelance Marketplace
items.description: RCT showing enhanced trust increases hiring but also disintermediation when trust is sufficiently high; platform design tradeoff.

items.name: Technology and Disintermediation in Online Marketplaces
items.description: Uses China Skype blockade as natural experiment; finds restricting communication reduces disintermediation by 18%.

items.name: Consumer Price Search and Platform Design in Internet Commerce
items.description: Uses eBay browsing data to show narrowing consumer choice sets can paradoxically strengthen seller competition and lower prices.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Information Design in Marketplaces

items.name: The Welfare Effects of Peer Entry: The Case of Airbnb and the Accommodation Industry
items.description: Structural model quantifying welfare: consumer surplus $41/night, host surplus $26/night; benefits concentrated during peak demand.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Information Design in Marketplaces

items.name: Peer-to-Peer Markets
items.description: Comprehensive framework covering search, matching, pricing, and reputation in peer platforms; essential survey paper.
items.category: Matching & Marketplaces > Information Design in Marketplaces

items.name: Counterspeculation, Auctions, and Competitive Sealed Tenders
items.description: Introduces second-price sealed-bid (Vickrey) auction; establishes truthful bidding as dominant strategy.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Auction Theory Foundations

items.name: Optimal Auction Design
items.description: Characterizes revenue-maximizing auctions; introduces virtual valuations and optimal reserves; Nobel Prize work.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Auction Theory Foundations

items.name: Optimal Auctions
items.description: Independently proves revenue equivalence theorem; shows optimal reserve prices increase revenue.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Auction Theory Foundations

items.name: A Theory of Auctions and Competitive Bidding
items.description: Introduces affiliated values and linkage principle; shows English auctions reduce winner's curse.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Auction Theory Foundations

items.name: Auctions Versus Negotiations
items.description: Demonstrates one additional bidder in simple auction outperforms optimally-designed negotiation; establishes competition's fundamental value in asymmetric settings.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Auction Theory Foundations

items.name: A Theory of Auctions and Competitive Bidding, II
items.description: Extends affiliated values to common value settings with asymmetric information; essential for understanding winner's curse in display advertising.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Auction Theory Foundations

items.name: Putting Auction Theory to Work
items.description: Practitioner's guide to designing real auctions; details SMRA for spectrum auctions; Nobel Prize foundation.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: The Lovely but Lonely Vickrey Auction
items.description: Explains why VCG rarely used in practice; introduces practical alternatives for combinatorial settings.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: Combinatorial Auctions
items.description: Comprehensive treatment of package bidding, winner determination, and spectrum auction design.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: Incentives in Teams
items.description: Generalizes incentive-compatible mechanisms with transfers; completes theoretical foundation for VCG.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: An Efficient Ascending-Bid Auction for Multiple Objects
items.description: Proposes 'clinching' auction achieving Vickrey outcomes dynamically while preserving privacy; eliminates demand reduction in uniform-price settings. Adopted in Treasury and spectrum auctions.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: Core-Selecting Package Auctions
items.description: Introduces mechanisms generating competitive revenues while minimizing shill-bidding incentives; theoretical foundation for FCC combinatorial clock auction payment rules.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: Clock Auctions and Radio Spectrum Reallocation
items.description: Develops deferred-acceptance clock auctions with strategy-proof properties; directly applied to FCC Incentive Auction ($19.8B, 2016-17). Nobel Prize-awarded work.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Multi-unit & Combinatorial Auctions

items.name: Learning in Repeated Auctions with Budgets
items.description: Introduces adaptive pacing strategies for budget-constrained bidders; proves regret bounds; foundational for ad auction budget management.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: Repeated Auctions with Budgets in Ad Exchanges
items.description: Analyzes fluid approximations for budget-constrained repeated auctions; practical design principles.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: Budget Management Strategies in Repeated Auctions
items.description: Compares pacing, throttling, and probabilistic strategies; Google research on platform budget management.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: Auto-bidding Auctions in the Presence of User Costs
items.description: Analyzes VCG with value-maximizing autobidders; shows cost multipliers improve welfare.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: Pacing Equilibrium in First Price Auction Markets
items.description: Proves first-price auctions with budget pacing guarantee equilibrium uniqueness and efficient computation; theoretical foundation for industry's second-to-first price transition.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: Multiplicative Pacing Equilibria in Auction Markets
items.description: Foundational paper proving existence of pacing equilibria for budget-constrained bidders; connects repeated auctions to competitive equilibrium theory.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: The Landscape of Auto-Bidding Auctions: Value Versus Utility Maximization
items.description: Compares value-maximizing versus utility-maximizing autobidders; shows first-best revenue achievable with value-maximizers. Essential for understanding modern autobidding platforms.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: Optimal Mechanisms for Value Maximizers with Budget Constraints via Target Clipping
items.description: Extends autobidding theory to budget-constrained value maximizers; proposes clipping mechanisms achieving near-optimal revenue.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: A Field Guide to Personalized Reserve Prices
items.description: Practical algorithms for learning optimal reserve prices at Google scale; bridges theory and deployed systems.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Dynamic Auctions & Repeated Games

items.name: College Admissions and the Stability of Marriage
items.description: Introduces deferred acceptance algorithm; proves existence of stable matchings; Nobel Prize foundation.

items.name: School Choice: A Mechanism Design Approach
items.description: Applies matching theory to school choice; shows Boston mechanism is manipulable; proposes strategy-proof alternatives.

items.name: Kidney Exchange
items.description: Designs kidney exchange clearinghouses using top trading cycles; Nobel Prize application.

items.name: Changing the Boston School Choice Mechanism
items.description: Documents Boston's switch to deferred acceptance; empirical evidence on strategic behavior.

items.name: Course Match: A Large-Scale Implementation of Approximate Competitive Equilibrium from Equal Incomes
items.description: Reports deployment of A-CEEI mechanism at Wharton (1,700 students, 350 courses); solves billions of mixed-integer programs. Definitive paper on scaling market design.

items.name: Commitment on Volunteer Crowdsourcing Platforms: Implications for Growth and Engagement
items.description: Studies optimal adoption policies on matching platforms using Food Rescue U.S. data; shows commitment mechanisms' impacts on growth versus engagement.

items.name: Course Allocation by Proxy Auction
items.description: Proposes proxy bidding countering strategic gaming in course allocation; key insight for automated assignment systems.

items.name: Strategic Information Transmission
items.description: Foundational cheap talk model; shows partition equilibria arise with interest misalignment.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Information Design & Signaling

items.name: Bayesian Persuasion
items.description: Introduces information design framework; characterizes sender-optimal signals via concavification; transformed the field.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Information Design & Signaling

items.name: Competition in Persuasion
items.description: Extends Bayesian persuasion to multiple senders; shows competition increases information revelation.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Information Design & Signaling

items.name: Information Design: A Unified Perspective
items.description: Comprehensive survey connecting Bayesian persuasion, mechanism design, and correlated equilibrium.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Information Design & Signaling

items.name: First-Price Auctions with General Information Structures: Implications for Bidding and Revenue
items.description: Characterizes equilibrium bidding across all possible information structures in first-price auctions; derives robust revenue bounds regardless of bidder information.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Information Design & Signaling

items.name: Optimal Information Disclosure in Classic Auctions
items.description: Characterizes revenue-maximizing information: reveal low values (increase competition) but pool high values. Provides rationale for conflation strategies in digital advertising.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Information Design & Signaling

items.name: Internet Advertising and the Generalized Second-Price Auction: Selling Billions of Dollars Worth of Keywords
items.description: First rigorous analysis of GSP mechanism used by Google/Yahoo; proves GSP lacks dominant strategy but identifies 'locally envy-free' equilibrium.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Sponsored Search & Display Ad Auctions

items.name: Position Auctions
items.description: Independent equilibrium analysis of search auctions; introduces quality-weighted ranking (bid × CTR); validates theory with Google data.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Sponsored Search & Display Ad Auctions

items.name: Sponsored Search Auctions
items.description: Authoritative survey integrating mechanism design, optimization, and ML perspectives on ad auctions.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Sponsored Search & Display Ad Auctions

items.name: Reserve Prices in Internet Advertising Auctions: A Field Experiment
items.description: First large-scale field experiment applying Myerson optimal auction theory to sponsored search at Yahoo; demonstrates ~12% revenue increase from optimized reserves.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Sponsored Search & Display Ad Auctions

items.name: Optimal Real-Time Bidding for Display Advertising
items.description: Formulates RTB as functional optimization; derives optimal bidding functions under budget constraints. Foundational for DSP bidding strategies.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Sponsored Search & Display Ad Auctions

items.name: Reserve Price Optimization for First Price Auctions in Display Advertising
items.description: Addresses industry's second-to-first price transition; proposes gradient-based reserve optimization validated on Google Ad Exchange data.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Sponsored Search & Display Ad Auctions

items.name: Algorithmic Mechanism Design
items.description: Foundational paper coining the field; establishes computational complexity constraints on mechanism design through scheduling problems where VCG fails.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Algorithmic Game Theory & Computational Mechanism Design

items.name: Simple versus Optimal Mechanisms
items.description: Proves simple mechanisms (Vickrey with anonymous reserves) achieve constant-factor approximation to optimal revenue; establishes simplicity-optimality tradeoff paradigm.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Algorithmic Game Theory & Computational Mechanism Design

items.name: Multi-Parameter Mechanism Design and Sequential Posted Pricing
items.description: Introduces sequential posted pricing as approximation to optimal multi-dimensional revenue; connects prophet inequalities to mechanism design.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Algorithmic Game Theory & Computational Mechanism Design

items.name: Optimal Multi-Dimensional Mechanism Design: Reducing Revenue to Welfare Maximization
items.description: Fundamental reduction showing every mechanism implementable as distribution over virtual VCG rules. FOCS Test of Time Award.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Algorithmic Game Theory & Computational Mechanism Design

items.name: Matroid Prophet Inequalities
items.description: Generalizes prophet inequality to matroid constraints; first efficient constant-approximations for multi-parameter settings.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Algorithmic Game Theory & Computational Mechanism Design

items.name: A Price Theory of Multi-Sided Platforms
items.description: General theory of monopoly platform pricing showing how platforms internalize network externalities only at the margin; foundational for understanding platform fee structures.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Platform Mechanism Design

items.name: Two-Sided Platforms: Product Variety and Pricing Structures
items.description: Models platform pricing when consumers value variety; shows variable fees trade off producer innovation against platform holdup.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Platform Mechanism Design

items.name: Multi-Sided Platforms
items.description: Comprehensive theory of firm choice between vertical integration and platform modes; directly applicable to Uber, Airbnb marketplace design.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Platform Mechanism Design

items.name: Online Labor Markets
items.description: Explores platform creators' choices of price structure, price level, and investment in online labor markets; early theoretical treatment of gig economy mechanism design.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Platform Mechanism Design

items.name: Equilibrium Effects of Pay Transparency
items.description: Demonstrates transparency reduces worker bargaining power in platform/gig markets using event-study of state transparency laws; essential for platform wage-setting policy.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Platform Mechanism Design

items.name: Mechanism Design via Differential Privacy
items.description: Seminal paper showing differential privacy ensures approximate dominant-strategy truthfulness under arbitrary utilities; introduces the exponential mechanism.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Privacy-Preserving & Differential Privacy Mechanisms

items.name: Selling Privacy at Auction
items.description: Initiates study of data markets through differential privacy lens; shows optimal designs are variants of multi-unit procurement auctions compensating data owners for privacy loss.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Privacy-Preserving & Differential Privacy Mechanisms

items.name: Privacy and Mechanism Design
items.description: Comprehensive survey showing differential privacy provides tools for controlling mechanism stability and designing truthful mechanisms without money.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Privacy-Preserving & Differential Privacy Mechanisms

items.name: Deconstructing Amazon EC2 Spot Instance Pricing
items.description: Reverse-engineers AWS spot pricing revealing hidden dynamic reserve mechanism rather than market-driven prices; critical insights for cloud users and providers.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Cloud & Computing Resource Auctions

items.name: Cloud Pricing: The Spot Market Strikes Back
items.description: Combines queuing theory and game theory analyzing when spot instances alongside fixed-price are profitable; accounts for cannibalization and preemption costs.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Cloud & Computing Resource Auctions

items.name: An Online Auction Framework for Dynamic Resource Provisioning in Cloud Computing
items.description: First online combinatorial auction for cloud handling dynamic arrivals; addresses revenue maximization and truthfulness jointly.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Cloud & Computing Resource Auctions

items.name: On the Cluster Admission Problem for Cloud Computing
items.description: Proposes admission control policies matching heterogeneous workloads to cloud resources via MDPs and information elicitation; significantly improves cluster utilization.
items.category: Mechanism Design & Auctions > Cloud & Computing Resource Auctions

items.name: Estimating Discrete-Choice Models of Product Differentiation
items.description: Introduces market share inversion mapping observed shares to mean utilities, enabling IV estimation with aggregate data.

items.name: Automobile Prices in Market Equilibrium
items.description: The canonical 'BLP' paper: random coefficients logit with unobserved product characteristics and endogenous prices.

items.name: A Practitioner's Guide to Estimation of Random-Coefficients Logit Models of Demand
items.description: Essential implementation guide clarifying BLP algorithms and computational practice.

items.name: Identification in Differentiated Products Markets Using Market Level Data
items.description: Rigorous nonparametric identification foundations establishing when demand is identified.

items.name: Best Practices for Differentiated Products Demand Estimation with PyBLP
items.description: Modern best practices with open-source Python implementation; addresses numerical stability and optimal instruments.

items.name: Valuing New Goods in a Model with Complementarity: Online Newspapers
items.description: Extends discrete choice to allow complementarity between products; estimates substitution between print and online news using Washington Post data. Essential for digital goods where products may be complements rather than substitutes.

items.name: Estimating Demand for Mobile Applications in the New Economy
items.description: BLP-style random coefficients nested logit for iOS and Android app stores; estimates $33.6 billion annual consumer surplus from mobile apps and quantifies in-app purchase and advertising effects.

items.name: Entry and Competition in Concentrated Markets
items.description: Foundational ordered probit entry model using threshold ratios to infer competitive effects from market structure.

items.name: Estimation of a Model of Entry in the Airline Industry
items.description: Methods for estimating discrete games with multiple equilibria; foundation for airline entry applications.

items.name: Empirical Models of Entry and Market Structure
items.description: Authoritative survey covering static and dynamic entry models with identification and estimation methods.

items.name: Market Structure and Multiple Equilibria in Airline Markets
items.description: Inference methods for entry games with multiple equilibria using partial identification.

items.name: The Welfare Effects of Peer Entry: The Case of Airbnb and the Accommodation Industry
items.description: Structural model of competition between 'flexible' peer suppliers (Airbnb) and 'dedicated' sellers (hotels). Finds Airbnb generated $41 consumer surplus per room-night with welfare gains concentrated during capacity-constrained periods.

items.name: What Happens When Wal-Mart Comes to Town: An Empirical Analysis of the Discount Retailing Industry
items.description: Develops computational methods for large-scale entry games; tractable approach for markets with many potential entrants relevant to platform expansion analysis.

items.name: Optimal Replacement of GMC Bus Engines: An Empirical Model of Harold Zurcher
items.description: Foundational paper introducing nested fixed point (NFXP) algorithm and conditional independence assumptions.

items.name: Conditional Choice Probabilities and the Estimation of Dynamic Models
items.description: Revolutionary CCP approach expressing value functions as functions of observable choice probabilities.

items.name: Sequential Estimation of Dynamic Discrete Games
items.description: Extends CCP to dynamic games; introduces nested pseudo-likelihood addressing computational challenges.

items.name: Conditional Choice Probability Estimation of Dynamic Discrete Choice Models with Unobserved Heterogeneity
items.description: Integrates unobserved heterogeneity into CCP estimators using EM algorithm.

items.name: Practical Methods for Estimation of Dynamic Discrete Choice Models
items.description: Excellent practical guide bridging theory and implementation.

items.name: Changing Their Tune: How Consumers' Adoption of Online Streaming Affects Music Consumption and Discovery
items.description: Studies consumption dynamics using individual listening histories across streaming platforms; finds streaming adoption increases quantity and diversity of music consumption.

items.name: State Dependence and Alternative Explanations for Consumer Inertia
items.description: Separates structural state dependence from heterogeneity using household scanner data; essential for understanding subscription stickiness and switching costs in digital services.

items.name: Optimal Nonparametric Estimation of First-Price Auctions
items.description: The foundational 'GPV' paper introducing nonparametric bid inversion to recover private value distributions.

items.name: Identification of Standard Auction Models
items.description: Establishes nonparametric identification conditions for major auction formats.

items.name: Nonparametric Approaches to Auctions
items.description: Comprehensive handbook chapter; authoritative survey of identification and estimation.

items.name: Identification and Estimation of Auction Models with Unobserved Heterogeneity
items.description: Addresses unobserved auction heterogeneity using multiplicative structure; widely applied in procurement.

items.name: An Empirical Perspective on Auctions
items.description: Applied survey covering auction theory testing and structural estimation in practice.

items.name: Internet Advertising and the Generalized Second-Price Auction: Selling Billions of Dollars Worth of Keywords
items.description: Foundational analysis of GSP auction mechanism used by Google and Yahoo; characterizes equilibria and proves revenue equivalence under complete information. Required reading for ad auction design.

items.name: A Structural Model of Sponsored Search Advertising Auctions
items.description: Structural econometric methods for estimating bidder valuations in sponsored search auctions; bridges GSP theory with empirical estimation of ad auction data.

items.name: The Dynamics of Productivity in the Telecommunications Equipment Industry
items.description: Foundational control function approach using investment to proxy for unobserved productivity.

items.name: Estimating Production Functions Using Inputs to Control for Unobservables
items.description: Uses intermediate inputs as proxy; more widely applicable than OP due to data availability.

items.name: Identification Properties of Recent Production Function Estimators
items.description: Resolves functional dependence problems in OP/LP; the 'ACF' estimator is now standard practice.

items.name: Markups and Firm-Level Export Status
items.description: Combines production function and markup estimation; highly influential applied methodology.

items.name: On the Identification of Gross Output Production Functions
items.description: Resolves identification issues with gross output using nonparametric IV methods.

items.name: Two-Sided Markets: A Progress Report
items.description: Canonical theoretical framework defining two-sided markets where price structure (not just level) matters; establishes concepts of membership fees, usage fees, and indirect network effects.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Platform & Network Effects Estimation

items.name: Competition Between Networks: A Study of the Market for Yellow Pages
items.description: First rigorous structural estimation of cross-side network effects in two-sided markets; estimates simultaneous equations for consumer demand, advertiser demand, and publisher pricing.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Platform & Network Effects Estimation

items.name: A Price Theory of Multi-Sided Platforms
items.description: General theory of monopoly platform pricing showing platforms internalize only marginal users' externalities (Spence distortion). Essential for understanding market power measurement in platform markets.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Platform & Network Effects Estimation

items.name: Identification of Peer Effects Through Social Networks
items.description: Provides necessary and sufficient conditions for identifying peer effects using network structure; shows how intransitive networks solve Manski's reflection problem.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Platform & Network Effects Estimation

items.name: Distinguishing Influence-Based Contagion from Homophily-Driven Diffusion in Dynamic Networks
items.description: Uses 27.4 million Yahoo users to separate peer influence from selection; shows previous methods overestimate influence by 300-700%. Essential methodology for network effect identification.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Platform & Network Effects Estimation

items.name: Evidence on Learning and Network Externalities in the Diffusion of Home Computers
items.description: Early empirical paper distinguishing network externalities from learning spillovers using geographic variation; finds effects tied to email/internet use, supporting communication network hypothesis.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Platform & Network Effects Estimation

items.name: The Welfare Effects of Bundling in Multichannel Television Markets
items.description: Full industry structural model combining viewership, demand, pricing, bundling, and Nash bargaining between distributors and content providers. Finds unbundling raises negotiated input costs 103%.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Digital Goods, Streaming & Content Markets

items.name: As Streaming Reaches Flood Stage, Does it Stimulate or Depress Music Sales?
items.description: Uses Spotify growth to estimate streaming's market impact; finds 137 streams displace 1 track sale but streaming also displaces piracy, making it approximately revenue-neutral.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Digital Goods, Streaming & Content Markets

items.name: Music for a Song: An Empirical Look at Uniform Pricing and Its Alternatives
items.description: Estimates willingness-to-pay for digital songs and simulates revenue under alternative pricing (bundling, two-part tariffs); finds bundling raises revenue 16-33% over uniform pricing.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Digital Goods, Streaming & Content Markets

items.name: The Effect of File Sharing on Record Sales: An Empirical Analysis
items.description: Most-cited digital piracy paper using matched file-sharing and sales data; uses German school holidays as instrument. Established the empirical agenda for piracy research.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Digital Goods, Streaming & Content Markets

items.name: Piracy and Copyright Enforcement Mechanisms
items.description: Authoritative synthesis reviewing piracy displacement effects, creative incentives, and enforcement effectiveness. Essential methodological guide for digital content research.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Digital Goods, Streaming & Content Markets

items.name: Consumer Surplus in the Digital Economy: Estimating the Value of Increased Product Variety at Online Booksellers
items.description: First rigorous estimation of 'Long Tail' welfare gains; shows Amazon variety benefits were 7-10x larger than price competition gains. Foundational paper quantifying why e-commerce matters.

items.name: Search, Obfuscation, and Price Elasticities on the Internet
items.description: Explains the price dispersion puzzle—why dispersion persists despite low online search costs. Shows retailers strategically make search harder through add-on pricing and complex fees.

items.name: Testing Models of Consumer Search Using Data on Web Browsing and Purchasing Behavior
items.description: Uses clickstream data to directly observe search sequences; rejects standard sequential search in favor of fixed sample size model. Methodological benchmark for structural search estimation.

items.name: Consumer Price Search and Platform Design in Internet Commerce
items.description: Equilibrium model of search and price competition on eBay; quantifies platform design trade-offs between match quality and price competition using detailed browsing data.

items.name: Auctions versus Posted Prices in Online Markets
items.description: Explains eBay's shift from auctions to posted prices by estimating demand trade-offs between price discovery and convenience using millions of seller experiments.

items.name: Using Price Distributions to Estimate Search Costs
items.description: Foundational methodology for backing out search cost distributions from equilibrium prices; underlies virtually all subsequent empirical search estimation.

items.name: The Power of Rankings: Quantifying the Effect of Rankings on Online Consumer Search and Purchase Decisions
items.description: Uses Expedia field experiment to causally identify position effects ($1.92/position); gold-standard paper on ranking effects in digital platforms. Bass Outstanding Dissertation Award winner.

items.name: Advertising, Consumer Awareness, and Choice: Evidence from the U.S. Banking Industry
items.description: Integrates costly search with endogenous consideration set formation; shows advertising shifts awareness rather than preferences, increasing competition.

items.name: What Makes Them Click: Empirical Analysis of Consumer Demand for Search Advertising
items.description: Canonical consumer-side structural model of sponsored search using Bing data; finds 51% more clicks would occur without ad competition. Essential for understanding attention allocation.

items.name: Double/Debiased Machine Learning for Treatment and Structural Parameters
items.description: Foundational framework for using ML to estimate nuisance parameters while preserving valid inference on structural parameters through orthogonal scores and cross-fitting.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Machine Learning & Structural Estimation

items.name: Estimation and Inference of Heterogeneous Treatment Effects using Random Forests
items.description: Develops causal forests for heterogeneous treatment effect estimation with valid confidence intervals. Critical for personalization, targeting, and A/B test analysis.
items.category: Structural Estimation > Machine Learning & Structural Estimation

items.name: Deep IV: A Flexible Approach for Counterfactual Prediction
